guides.readmeRaw:
# Ansible Installation Guide

Agentless automation platform for configuration management, application deployment, and task automation across multiple systems.

## Prerequisites

- Linux control machine (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS, or compatible)
- SSH access to target hosts
- Python 3.8+ on control machine
- Python 2.7+ or 3.5+ on target hosts

## Installation

### Using Package Manager (Recommended)

#### Ubuntu/Debian
```bash
# Update package list
sudo apt update

# Install Ansible
sudo apt install -y ansible

# Install additional collections
ansible-galaxy collection install community.general
ansible-galaxy collection install ansible.posix
```

#### RHEL/CentOS/Rocky Linux
```bash
# Install EPEL repository
sudo yum install -y epel-release

# Install Ansible
sudo yum install -y ansible

# For CentOS Stream/RHEL 8+
sudo dnf install -y ansible
```

### Using pip (Latest Version)
```bash
# Install pip if not available
sudo apt install -y python3-pip

# Install Ansible via pip
pip3 install --user ansible

# Add to PATH
echo 'export PATH=$PATH:~/.local/bin' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc

# Install additional collections
ansible-galaxy collection install community.general
ansible-galaxy collection install ansible.posix
ansible-galaxy collection install kubernetes.core
```

### Using Docker
```bash
# Create Ansible Docker container
docker run --rm -it \
  -v $(pwd):/ansible \
  -v ~/.ssh:/root/.ssh:ro \
  --workdir /ansible \
  ansible/ansible:latest \
  ansible-playbook playbook.yml

# Create alias for convenience
echo 'alias ansible-docker="docker run --rm -it -v $(pwd):/ansible -v ~/.ssh:/root/.ssh:ro --workdir /ansible ansible/ansible:latest"' >> ~/.bashrc
```

## Configuration

### Inventory Setup
```bash
# Create project structure
mkdir -p ~/ansible-project/{inventories,playbooks,roles,group_vars,host_vars}
cd ~/ansible-project

# Create inventory file
cat > inventories/production/hosts.yml <<EOF
all:
  children:
    webservers:
      hosts:
        web1:
          ansible_host: 192.168.1.10
          ansible_user: ubuntu
        web2:
          ansible_host: 192.168.1.11
          ansible_user: ubuntu
    dbservers:
      hosts:
        db1:
          ansible_host: 192.168.1.20
          ansible_user: ubuntu
        db2:
          ansible_host: 192.168.1.21
          ansible_user: ubuntu
    loadbalancers:
      hosts:
        lb1:
          ansible_host: 192.168.1.30
          ansible_user: ubuntu

webservers:
  vars:
    http_port: 80
    max_clients: 200

dbservers:
  vars:
    mysql_port: 3306
    mysql_root_password: "{{ vault_mysql_root_password }}"
EOF

# Create ansible configuration
cat > ansible.cfg <<EOF
[defaults]
inventory = inventories/production/hosts.yml
remote_user = ubuntu
private_key_file = ~/.ssh/id_rsa
host_key_checking = False
retry_files_enabled = False
stdout_callback = yaml
bin_ansible_callbacks = True

[ssh_connection]
ssh_args = -o ControlMaster=auto -o ControlPersist=60s
pipelining = True
control_path = ~/.ansible/cp/%%h-%%p-%%r
EOF
```

### Ansible Vault for Secrets
```bash
# Create encrypted vault file
ansible-vault create group_vars/all/vault.yml
# Enter vault password and add:
# vault_mysql_root_password: your_secure_password
# vault_api_key: your_api_key

# Edit vault file
ansible-vault edit group_vars/all/vault.yml

# View vault file
ansible-vault view group_vars/all/vault.yml

# Create vault password file
echo "your_vault_password" > ~/.ansible_vault_pass
chmod 600 ~/.ansible_vault_pass

# Update ansible.cfg
echo "vault_password_file = ~/.ansible_vault_pass" >> ansible.cfg
```

## Playbooks

### Basic System Setup Playbook
```bash
cat > playbooks/system-setup.yml <<EOF
---
- name: System Setup and Hardening
  hosts: all
  become: yes
  vars:
    packages:
      - curl
      - wget
      - vim
      - htop
      - fail2ban
      - ufw
      
  tasks:
    - name: Update package cache
      apt:
        update_cache: yes
        cache_valid_time: 3600
      when: ansible_os_family == "Debian"
    
    - name: Update package cache (RHEL/CentOS)
      yum:
        update_cache: yes
      when: ansible_os_family == "RedHat"
    
    - name: Install essential packages
      package:
        name: "{{ packages }}"
        state: present
    
    - name: Create admin user
      user:
        name: admin
        groups: sudo
        shell: /bin/bash
        create_home: yes
        generate_ssh_key: yes
    
    - name: Configure SSH
      lineinfile:
        path: /etc/ssh/sshd_config
        regexp: "{{ item.regexp }}"
        line: "{{ item.line }}"
        backup: yes
      loop:
        - { regexp: '^#?PermitRootLogin', line: 'PermitRootLogin no' }
        - { regexp: '^#?PasswordAuthentication', line: 'PasswordAuthentication no' }
        - { regexp: '^#?X11Forwarding', line: 'X11Forwarding no' }
      notify: restart ssh
    
    - name: Configure UFW firewall
      ufw:
        state: enabled
        policy: deny
        direction: incoming
    
    - name: Allow SSH through firewall
      ufw:
        rule: allow
        port: 22
        proto: tcp
  
  handlers:
    - name: restart ssh
      service:
        name: "{{ 'ssh' if ansible_os_family == 'Debian' else 'sshd' }}"
        state: restarted
EOF
```

### Web Server Deployment Playbook
```bash
cat > playbooks/nginx-deployment.yml <<EOF
---
- name: Deploy NGINX Web Server
  hosts: webservers
  become: yes
  vars:
    domain_name: example.com
    
  tasks:
    - name: Install NGINX
      package:
        name: nginx
        state: present
    
    - name: Create document root
      file:
        path: "/var/www/{{ domain_name }}/html"
        state: directory
        owner: www-data
        group: www-data
        mode: '0755'
    
    - name: Deploy website content
      template:
        src: templates/index.html.j2
        dest: "/var/www/{{ domain_name }}/html/index.html"
        owner: www-data
        group: www-data
        mode: '0644'
      notify: reload nginx
    
    - name: Configure NGINX virtual host
      template:
        src: templates/nginx-vhost.conf.j2
        dest: "/etc/nginx/sites-available/{{ domain_name }}.conf"
        backup: yes
      notify: reload nginx
    
    - name: Enable NGINX site
      file:
        src: "/etc/nginx/sites-available/{{ domain_name }}.conf"
        dest: "/etc/nginx/sites-enabled/{{ domain_name }}.conf"
        state: link
      notify: reload nginx
    
    - name: Ensure NGINX is running
      service:
        name: nginx
        state: started
        enabled: yes
    
    - name: Configure firewall for web traffic
      ufw:
        rule: allow
        port: "{{ item }}"
        proto: tcp
      loop:
        - 80
        - 443
  
  handlers:
    - name: reload nginx
      service:
        name: nginx
        state: reloaded
EOF
```

### Multi-Environment Deployment
```bash
cat > playbooks/application-deployment.yml <<EOF
---
- name: Deploy Application Stack
  hosts: all
  become: yes
  vars:
    app_name: myapp
    app_version: "{{ lookup('env', 'APP_VERSION') | default('latest') }}"
    environment: "{{ ansible_environment | default('production') }}"
    
  tasks:
    - name: Create application user
      user:
        name: "{{ app_name }}"
        system: yes
        shell: /bin/false
        home: "/opt/{{ app_name }}"
        create_home: yes
    
    - name: Deploy application
      unarchive:
        src: "https://github.com/company/{{ app_name }}/releases/download/{{ app_version }}/{{ app_name }}-{{ app_version }}.tar.gz"
        dest: "/opt/{{ app_name }}"
        owner: "{{ app_name }}"
        group: "{{ app_name }}"
        remote_src: yes
      notify: restart application
    
    - name: Install systemd service
      template:
        src: templates/app.service.j2
        dest: "/etc/systemd/system/{{ app_name }}.service"
      notify:
        - daemon reload
        - restart application
    
    - name: Start and enable application
      systemd:
        name: "{{ app_name }}"
        state: started
        enabled: yes
        daemon_reload: yes
  
  handlers:
    - name: daemon reload
      systemd:
        daemon_reload: yes
    
    - name: restart application
      systemd:
        name: "{{ app_name }}"
        state: restarted
EOF
```

## Roles Development

```bash
# Create role structure
ansible-galaxy init roles/nginx

# roles/nginx/tasks/main.yml
cat > roles/nginx/tasks/main.yml <<EOF
---
- name: Install NGINX
  package:
    name: nginx
    state: present

- name: Start and enable NGINX
  service:
    name: nginx
    state: started
    enabled: yes

- name: Configure NGINX
  template:
    src: nginx.conf.j2
    dest: /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
    backup: yes
  notify: reload nginx

- name: Create virtual hosts
  template:
    src: vhost.conf.j2
    dest: "/etc/nginx/sites-available/{{ item.name }}.conf"
  loop: "{{ nginx_vhosts }}"
  when: nginx_vhosts is defined
  notify: reload nginx

- name: Enable virtual hosts
  file:
    src: "/etc/nginx/sites-available/{{ item.name }}.conf"
    dest: "/etc/nginx/sites-enabled/{{ item.name }}.conf"
    state: link
  loop: "{{ nginx_vhosts }}"
  when: nginx_vhosts is defined
  notify: reload nginx
EOF

# Use role in playbook
cat > playbooks/webserver.yml <<EOF
---
- name: Configure Web Servers
  hosts: webservers
  become: yes
  roles:
    - nginx
  vars:
    nginx_vhosts:
      - name: example.com
        root: /var/www/example.com/html
        index: index.html
EOF
```

## Verification

```bash
# Check Ansible version
ansible --version

# Test connectivity to all hosts
ansible all -m ping

# Check facts gathering
ansible all -m setup

# Test specific host
ansible web1 -m command -a "uptime"

# Run playbook in check mode (dry run)
ansible-playbook playbooks/system-setup.yml --check

# Run playbook with specific inventory
ansible-playbook -i inventories/staging/hosts.yml playbooks/system-setup.yml

# Run specific tasks
ansible-playbook playbooks/system-setup.yml --tags "firewall"

# Skip specific tasks
ansible-playbook playbooks/system-setup.yml --skip-tags "packages"

# Run on specific hosts
ansible-playbook playbooks/system-setup.yml --limit webservers

# Verbose output
ansible-playbook playbooks/system-setup.yml -vvv
```

## Performance and Optimization

```bash
# Parallel execution
ansible-playbook playbooks/system-setup.yml --forks 10

# Pipelining for faster execution
echo "pipelining = True" >> ansible.cfg

# Fact caching
echo "gathering = smart" >> ansible.cfg
echo "fact_caching = jsonfile" >> ansible.cfg
echo "fact_caching_connection = ~/.ansible/facts_cache" >> ansible.cfg
echo "fact_caching_timeout = 86400" >> ansible.cfg

# Strategy plugins
ansible-playbook playbooks/system-setup.yml --strategy free

# Async tasks for long-running operations
- name: Long running task
  command: /usr/bin/long_running_command
  async: 300
  poll: 5
```

## Additional Resources

- [Official Documentation](https://docs.ansible.com/)
- [Ansible Galaxy](https://galaxy.ansible.com/)
- [Best Practices](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_best_practices.html)
- [Ansible Examples](https://github.com/ansible/ansible-examples)
- [Community Collections](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/index.html)

---

**Note:** This guide is part of the [HowToMgr](https://howtomgr.github.io) collection.

guides.readmeRaw:
# Apache HTTP Server Installation Guide

World's most popular web server software serving over 40% of active websites. Reliable, secure, and highly configurable for hosting websites and web applications.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (any modern distribution)
- Root or sudo access  
- 1GB RAM minimum, 2GB+ recommended for production
- Network connectivity for package downloads

## Installation

### Ubuntu/Debian
```bash
# Update package list
sudo apt update

# Install Apache and essential modules
sudo apt install -y apache2 apache2-utils

# Enable essential modules
sudo a2enmod rewrite ssl headers deflate expires security2

# Start and enable Apache
sudo systemctl enable --now apache2

# Check status
sudo systemctl status apache2
```

### RHEL/CentOS/Rocky Linux/AlmaLinux
```bash
# Install Apache (httpd)
sudo yum install -y httpd httpd-tools mod_ssl

# For newer versions with dnf
sudo dnf install -y httpd httpd-tools mod_ssl

# Start and enable Apache
sudo systemctl enable --now httpd

# Check status
sudo systemctl status httpd
```

### Fedora
```bash
# Install Apache
sudo dnf install -y httpd httpd-tools mod_ssl mod_security

# Start and enable Apache
sudo systemctl enable --now httpd

# Configure firewall
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=http
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=https
sudo firewall-cmd --reload
```

### Arch Linux
```bash
# Install Apache
sudo pacman -Syu apache

# Start and enable Apache
sudo systemctl enable --now httpd

# Edit configuration
sudo nano /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf
# Uncomment: ServerName www.example.com:80
```

### openSUSE/SUSE
```bash
# Install Apache
sudo zypper install -y apache2 apache2-mod_ssl apache2-utils

# Start and enable Apache
sudo systemctl enable --now apache2

# Configure firewall
sudo SuSEfirewall2 open EXT TCP 80 443
```

### Alpine Linux
```bash
# Install Apache
sudo apk update
sudo apk add apache2 apache2-ssl apache2-utils

# Create necessary directories
sudo mkdir -p /var/www/html
sudo mkdir -p /run/apache2

# Start and enable Apache
sudo rc-update add apache2 default
sudo service apache2 start
```

### Docker Installation
```bash
# Official Apache Docker image
docker run -d \
  --name apache \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 80:80 \
  -p 443:443 \
  -v ~/apache/htdocs:/usr/local/apache2/htdocs/ \
  -v ~/apache/conf:/usr/local/apache2/conf/ \
  -v ~/apache/logs:/usr/local/apache2/logs/ \
  httpd:latest

# With Docker Compose
cat > docker-compose.yml <<EOF
version: '3.8'
services:
  apache:
    image: httpd:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "80:80"
      - "443:443"
    volumes:
      - ./htdocs:/usr/local/apache2/htdocs/
      - ./conf/httpd.conf:/usr/local/apache2/conf/httpd.conf
      - ./logs:/usr/local/apache2/logs/
    networks:
      - webserver

networks:
  webserver:
    driver: bridge
EOF

docker-compose up -d
```

### Source Compilation (Advanced)
```bash
# Install build dependencies
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y build-essential libapr1-dev libaprutil1-dev libpcre3-dev libssl-dev zlib1g-dev

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo yum groupinstall -y "Development Tools"
sudo yum install -y apr-devel apr-util-devel pcre-devel openssl-devel zlib-devel

# Download Apache source
cd /tmp
wget https://archive.apache.org/dist/httpd/httpd-2.4.57.tar.gz
tar xzf httpd-2.4.57.tar.gz
cd httpd-2.4.57

# Configure with security and performance modules
./configure \
  --prefix=/etc/apache2 \
  --exec-prefix=/usr \
  --bindir=/usr/bin \
  --sbindir=/usr/sbin \
  --sysconfdir=/etc/apache2 \
  --libexecdir=/usr/lib/apache2/modules \
  --localstatedir=/var \
  --datadir=/usr/share/apache2 \
  --includedir=/usr/include/apache2 \
  --infodir=/usr/share/info \
  --mandir=/usr/share/man \
  --with-program-name=apache2 \
  --enable-layout=Debian \
  --with-regex=pcre \
  --enable-mods-shared=reallyall \
  --enable-ssl \
  --enable-rewrite \
  --enable-headers \
  --enable-deflate \
  --enable-expires \
  --enable-security \
  --with-ssl=/usr \
  --with-ldap \
  --with-ldap-include=/usr/include \
  --with-ldap-lib=/usr/lib

# Compile and install
make -j$(nproc)
sudo make install

# Create apache user
sudo useradd -r -s /sbin/nologin apache

# Create systemd service
sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/apache2.service > /dev/null <<EOF
[Unit]
Description=The Apache HTTP Server
After=network.target remote-fs.target nss-lookup.target

[Service]
Type=notify
ExecStart=/usr/sbin/apache2 -DFOREGROUND
ExecReload=/usr/sbin/apache2ctl graceful
ExecStop=/bin/kill -WINTERM \${MAINPID}
KillSignal=SIGCONT
PrivateTmp=true

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
EOF

sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl enable --now apache2
```

## Security Hardening (2024 Best Practices)

### Hide Server Information
```bash
# Create security configuration
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo tee /etc/apache2/conf-available/security-hardening.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Hide Apache version and OS information
ServerTokens Prod
ServerSignature Off

# Hide PHP version (if using PHP)
Header always unset X-Powered-By
Header unset X-Powered-By

# Security headers (2024 recommendations)
Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload"
Header always set X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN"
Header always set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
Header always set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
Header always set Referrer-Policy "strict-origin-when-cross-origin"
Header always set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: https:; font-src 'self' data:; connect-src 'self'; media-src 'self'; object-src 'none'; child-src 'self'; form-action 'self'; base-uri 'self';"
Header always set Permissions-Policy "camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=()"

# Remove sensitive headers
Header always unset Server
Header unset Server

# Disable server status and info
<Location "/server-status">
    SetHandler server-status
    Require local
</Location>

<Location "/server-info">
    SetHandler server-info
    Require local
</Location>

# Disable trace method
TraceEnable off

# Timeout configurations
Timeout 60
KeepAliveTimeout 15

# Limit request size (adjust as needed)
LimitRequestBody 10485760  # 10MB

# Hide .htaccess files
<FilesMatch "^\.ht">
    Require all denied
</FilesMatch>

# Hide backup and temporary files
<FilesMatch "\.(bak|backup|swp|tmp|~)$">
    Require all denied
</FilesMatch>

# Disable directory browsing by default
Options -Indexes

# Information disclosure protection
<DirectoryMatch "/\.">
    Require all denied
</DirectoryMatch>

# Clickjacking protection
Header always append X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN
EOF

# Enable security configuration
sudo a2enconf security-hardening
sudo systemctl reload apache2

# RHEL/CentOS (add to main configuration)
sudo tee -a /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf > /dev/null <<EOF

# Security hardening
ServerTokens Prod
ServerSignature Off

# Load security headers module
LoadModule headers_module modules/mod_headers.so

# Security headers
Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload"
Header always set X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN"
Header always set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
Header always set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
Header always set Referrer-Policy "strict-origin-when-cross-origin"

# Disable trace method
TraceEnable off

# Hide .htaccess files
<FilesMatch "^\.ht">
    Require all denied
</FilesMatch>

# Disable directory browsing
Options -Indexes
EOF

sudo systemctl reload httpd
```

### ModSecurity WAF Installation
```bash
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y libapache2-mod-security2

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo yum install -y mod_security mod_security_crs

# Enable ModSecurity
sudo a2enmod security2  # Ubuntu/Debian

# Download OWASP Core Rule Set
sudo mkdir -p /etc/apache2/modsecurity.d
cd /etc/apache2/modsecurity.d
sudo wget https://github.com/coreruleset/coreruleset/archive/refs/tags/v3.3.4.tar.gz
sudo tar xzf v3.3.4.tar.gz
sudo mv coreruleset-3.3.4 crs

# Configure ModSecurity
sudo tee /etc/apache2/mods-available/security2.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
<IfModule mod_security2.c>
    SecRuleEngine On
    SecRequestBodyAccess On
    SecRequestBodyLimit 13107200
    SecRequestBodyNoFilesLimit 131072
    SecRequestBodyInMemoryLimit 131072
    SecRequestBodyLimitAction Reject
    SecRule REQUEST_HEADERS:Content-Type "text/xml" \
         "id:'200000',phase:1,t:none,t:lowercase,pass,nolog,ctl:requestBodyProcessor=XML"
    SecRule REQUEST_HEADERS:Content-Type "application/json" \
         "id:'200001',phase:1,t:none,t:lowercase,pass,nolog,ctl:requestBodyProcessor=JSON"
    SecRule REQBODY_ERROR "!@eq 0" \
    "id:'200002', phase:2,t:none,log,deny,status:400,msg:'Failed to parse request body.',logdata:'Error %{REQBODY_ERROR_MSG}',severity:2"
    SecRule MULTIPART_STRICT_ERROR "!@eq 0" \
    "id:'200003',phase:2,t:none,log,deny,status:400, \
    msg:'Multipart request body failed strict validation: \
    PE %{REQBODY_PROCESSOR_ERROR}, \
    BQ %{MULTIPART_BOUNDARY_QUOTED}, \
    BW %{MULTIPART_BOUNDARY_WHITESPACE}, \
    DB %{MULTIPART_DATA_BEFORE}, \
    DA %{MULTIPART_DATA_AFTER}, \
    HF %{MULTIPART_HEADER_FOLDING}, \
    LF %{MULTIPART_LF_LINE}, \
    SM %{MULTIPART_MISSING_SEMICOLON}, \
    IQ %{MULTIPART_INVALID_QUOTING}, \
    IP %{MULTIPART_INVALID_PART}, \
    IH %{MULTIPART_INVALID_HEADER_FOLDING}, \
    FL %{MULTIPART_FILE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED}'"

    SecRule MULTIPART_UNMATCHED_BOUNDARY "!@eq 0" \
    "id:'200004',phase:2,t:none,log,deny,msg:'Multipart parser detected a possible unmatched boundary.'"

    SecPcreMatchLimit 1000
    SecPcreMatchLimitRecursion 1000

    SecRule TX:/^MSC_/ "!@streq 0" \
            "id:'200005',phase:2,t:none,deny,msg:'ModSecurity internal error flagged: %{MATCHED_VAR_NAME}'"

    SecResponseBodyAccess Off
    SecDebugLog /var/log/apache2/modsec_debug.log
    SecDebugLogLevel 0
    SecAuditEngine RelevantOnly
    SecAuditLogRelevantStatus "^(?:5|4(?!04))"
    SecAuditLogParts ABDEFHIJZ
    SecAuditLogType Serial
    SecAuditLog /var/log/apache2/modsec_audit.log
    
    # Include OWASP Core Rule Set
    Include /etc/apache2/modsecurity.d/crs/crs-setup.conf.example
    Include /etc/apache2/modsecurity.d/crs/rules/*.conf
</IfModule>
EOF

# Create data directory
sudo mkdir -p /var/cache/modsecurity
sudo chown www-data:www-data /var/cache/modsecurity

sudo systemctl reload apache2
```

### SSL/TLS Configuration (Modern 2024 Standards)
```bash
# Create modern SSL configuration
sudo tee /etc/apache2/conf-available/ssl-modern.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Modern SSL configuration (2024)
SSLEngine on

# Protocols - Only TLS 1.2 and 1.3
SSLProtocol all -SSLv3 -TLSv1 -TLSv1.1

# Cipher suites for modern browsers (2024)
SSLCipherSuite ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305:ECDHE-RSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305:DHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384

# Prefer server ciphers for TLS 1.2, client ciphers for TLS 1.3
SSLHonorCipherOrder off

# HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security)
Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload"

# Session cache
SSLSessionCache shmcb:/var/run/ssl_scache(512000)
SSLSessionCacheTimeout 300

# OCSP Stapling
SSLUseStapling On
SSLStaplingCache shmcb:/var/run/ocsp(128000)
SSLStaplingResponderTimeout 5
SSLStaplingReturnResponderErrors off

# Modern security options
SSLCompression off
SSLSessionTickets off

# Perfect Forward Secrecy
SSLOpenSSLConfCmd DHParameters /etc/ssl/certs/dhparam.pem
EOF

# Generate strong DH parameters
sudo openssl dhparam -out /etc/ssl/certs/dhparam.pem 2048

# Enable SSL configuration
sudo a2enconf ssl-modern
sudo a2enmod ssl headers
sudo systemctl reload apache2
```

### Secure Virtual Host Configuration
```bash
# Create production-ready virtual host
sudo tee /etc/apache2/sites-available/secure-site.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# HTTP to HTTPS redirect
<VirtualHost *:80>
    ServerName example.com
    ServerAlias www.example.com
    
    # Security headers for redirects
    Header always set X-Content-Type-Options nosniff
    Header always set X-Frame-Options DENY
    
    # Redirect to HTTPS
    Redirect permanent / https://example.com/
</VirtualHost>

# HTTPS Virtual Host
<VirtualHost *:443>
    ServerName example.com
    ServerAlias www.example.com
    DocumentRoot /var/www/html/example.com
    
    # SSL Configuration
    SSLEngine on
    SSLCertificateFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/fullchain.pem
    SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/privkey.pem
    
    # Security headers (2024 standards)
    Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload"
    Header always set X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN"
    Header always set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
    Header always set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
    Header always set Referrer-Policy "strict-origin-when-cross-origin"
    Header always set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: https:; font-src 'self' data:; connect-src 'self'; media-src 'self'; object-src 'none'; child-src 'self'; form-action 'self'; base-uri 'self';"
    Header always set Permissions-Policy "camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=()"
    
    # Remove server information
    Header always unset Server
    Header unset X-Powered-By
    
    <Directory /var/www/html/example.com>
        Options -Indexes +FollowSymLinks
        AllowOverride All
        Require all granted
        
        # Additional security
        <Files ".*">
            Require all denied
        </Files>
        
        <Files "*.php~">
            Require all denied
        </Files>
        
        <Files "*.inc">
            Require all denied
        </Files>
    </Directory>
    
    # PHP configuration (if using PHP)
    <IfModule mod_php.c>
        php_admin_flag allow_url_include Off
        php_admin_flag allow_url_fopen Off
        php_admin_flag file_uploads On
        php_admin_value upload_max_filesize 64M
        php_admin_value post_max_size 64M
        php_admin_value memory_limit 256M
        php_admin_value max_execution_time 300
        php_admin_flag expose_php Off
    </IfModule>
    
    # Compression
    <IfModule mod_deflate.c>
        SetOutputFilter DEFLATE
        AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/css text/javascript text/xml text/plain application/javascript application/xml+rss application/xml application/x-javascript application/json
        
        # Don't compress images
        SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \.(?:gif|jpe?g|png)$ no-gzip dont-vary
        SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \.(?:exe|t?gz|zip|bz2|sit|rar)$ no-gzip dont-vary
    </IfModule>
    
    # Caching rules
    <IfModule mod_expires.c>
        ExpiresActive On
        ExpiresByType image/jpg "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/jpeg "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/gif "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/png "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/webp "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType text/css "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType application/pdf "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType text/javascript "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType application/javascript "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType application/x-javascript "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType application/x-shockwave-flash "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/x-icon "access plus 1 year"
        ExpiresDefault "access plus 2 days"
    </IfModule>
    
    # Rate limiting (if mod_evasive is available)
    <IfModule mod_evasive24.c>
        DOSHashTableSize    1024
        DOSPageCount        2
        DOSSiteCount        50
        DOSPageInterval     1
        DOSSiteInterval     1
        DOSBlockingPeriod   600
        DOSLogDir           /var/log/apache2/
        DOSEmailNotify      admin@example.com
    </IfModule>
    
    # ModSecurity
    <IfModule mod_security2.c>
        SecRuleEngine On
        SecDefaultAction "log,auditlog,pass"
    </IfModule>
    
    ErrorLog \${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/example.com_error.log
    CustomLog \${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/example.com_access.log combined
    
    # Log security events
    CustomLog \${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/example.com_security.log "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-agent}i\"" env=security
</VirtualHost>

# WWW redirect
<VirtualHost *:443>
    ServerName www.example.com
    
    SSLEngine on
    SSLCertificateFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/fullchain.pem
    SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/privkey.pem
    
    Redirect permanent / https://example.com/
</VirtualHost>
EOF

sudo a2ensite secure-site.conf
sudo a2enconf security-hardening
sudo systemctl reload apache2
```

### Advanced Security Modules
```bash
# Install additional security modules
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y libapache2-mod-evasive libapache2-mod-security2

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo yum install -y mod_evasive mod_security

# Enable modules
sudo a2enmod evasive  # Ubuntu/Debian
sudo a2enmod security2

# Configure mod_evasive (DDoS protection)
sudo tee /etc/apache2/mods-available/evasive.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
<IfModule mod_evasive24.c>
    DOSHashTableSize    1024
    DOSPageCount        3
    DOSSiteCount        50
    DOSPageInterval     1
    DOSSiteInterval     1

    DOSLogDir           /var/log/apache2/
    DOSEmailNotify      admin@example.com
```

## SSL Certificate Setup (Cross-Platform)

### Let's Encrypt Integration
```bash
# Install Certbot - Universal method
sudo snap install core; sudo snap refresh core
sudo snap install --classic certbot
sudo ln -s /snap/bin/certbot /usr/bin/certbot

# Alternative: Package manager installation
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y certbot python3-certbot-apache

# RHEL/CentOS (enable EPEL first)
sudo yum install -y epel-release
sudo yum install -y certbot python3-certbot-apache

# Fedora
sudo dnf install -y certbot python3-certbot-apache

# Arch Linux
sudo pacman -S certbot certbot-apache

# Obtain certificate
sudo certbot --apache -d example.com -d www.example.com

# Auto-renewal setup (universal)
sudo crontab -e
# Add: 0 12 * * * /usr/bin/certbot renew --quiet && systemctl reload apache2

# Test renewal
sudo certbot renew --dry-run
```

### Manual SSL Configuration
```bash
# Generate self-signed certificate for testing
sudo mkdir -p /etc/ssl/private
sudo openssl req -x509 -nodes -days 365 -newkey rsa:4096 \
  -keyout /etc/ssl/private/apache-selfsigned.key \
  -out /etc/ssl/certs/apache-selfsigned.crt \
  -subj "/C=US/ST=State/L=City/O=Organization/CN=example.com"

# Create SSL configuration snippet
sudo tee /etc/apache2/conf-available/ssl-params.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Modern SSL configuration
SSLEngine on
SSLProtocol all -SSLv3 -TLSv1 -TLSv1.1
SSLCipherSuite ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
SSLHonorCipherOrder off
SSLSessionTickets off
SSLUseStapling on
SSLStaplingCache shmcb:/var/run/ssl_stapling(32768)
SSLOpenSSLConfCmd DHParameters /etc/ssl/certs/dhparam.pem

# Security headers
Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=63072000; includeSubDomains; preload"
Header always set X-Content-Type-Options nosniff
Header always set X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN
Header always set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
EOF

sudo a2enconf ssl-params
```

## Firewall Configuration (All Platforms)

### UFW (Ubuntu/Debian)
```bash
sudo ufw app list | grep Apache
sudo ufw allow 'Apache Full'    # HTTP and HTTPS
sudo ufw allow 'Apache'         # HTTP only  
sudo ufw allow 'Apache Secure'  # HTTPS only
sudo ufw enable
sudo ufw status
```

### Firewalld (RHEL/CentOS/Fedora)
```bash
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=http
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=https
sudo firewall-cmd --reload
sudo firewall-cmd --list-services
```

### iptables (Universal)
```bash
# Allow HTTP and HTTPS
sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 80 -j ACCEPT
sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 443 -j ACCEPT

# Save rules (varies by distribution)
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y iptables-persistent
sudo netfilter-persistent save

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo service iptables save

# Arch Linux

# Alpine Linux
sudo /etc/init.d/iptables save
```

### SELinux Configuration (RHEL/CentOS/Fedora)
```bash
# Check SELinux status
getenforce

# Set SELinux booleans for Apache
sudo setsebool -P httpd_can_network_connect 1
sudo setsebool -P httpd_can_network_relay 1
sudo setsebool -P httpd_use_nfs 1
sudo setsebool -P httpd_graceful_shutdown 1

# For custom content directories
sudo semanage fcontext -a -t httpd_exec_t "/var/www/html(/.*)?"
sudo restorecon -Rv /var/www/html/
```

## Performance Optimization

### Multi-Processing Module (MPM) Tuning
```bash
# Check current MPM
apache2ctl -M | grep mpm  # Ubuntu/Debian
httpd -M | grep mpm       # RHEL/CentOS

# Configure Event MPM (most efficient)
sudo tee /etc/apache2/mods-available/mpm_event.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
<IfModule mpm_event_module>
    StartServers             3
    MinSpareThreads         75
    MaxSpareThreads        250
    ThreadsPerChild         25
    MaxRequestWorkers      400
    MaxConnectionsPerChild   0
    AsyncRequestWorkerFactor 2
</IfModule>
EOF

# Enable Event MPM
sudo a2dismod mpm_prefork
sudo a2enmod mpm_event
sudo systemctl restart apache2
```

### System-level Performance Tuning
```bash
# Increase system limits
sudo tee -a /etc/security/limits.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
apache soft nofile 65535
apache hard nofile 65535
www-data soft nofile 65535
www-data hard nofile 65535
EOF

# Kernel optimization for web servers
sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Apache/web server optimization
net.core.somaxconn = 65535
net.core.netdev_max_backlog = 5000
net.ipv4.tcp_max_syn_backlog = 65535
net.ipv4.tcp_fin_timeout = 10
net.ipv4.tcp_tw_reuse = 1
net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range = 15000 65000
fs.file-max = 100000

# Memory management
vm.swappiness = 10
vm.dirty_ratio = 15
vm.dirty_background_ratio = 5
EOF

sudo sysctl -p
```

### Caching Configuration
```bash
# Enable caching modules
sudo a2enmod cache cache_disk expires headers

# Create cache configuration
sudo tee /etc/apache2/conf-available/caching.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Disk cache configuration
<IfModule mod_cache_disk.c>
    CacheRoot /var/cache/apache2/mod_cache_disk
    CacheDirLevels 2
    CacheDirLength 1
    CacheEnable disk /
    CacheIgnoreHeaders Set-Cookie
    CacheDefaultExpire 3600
    CacheMaxExpire 86400
    CacheLastModifiedFactor 0.1
</IfModule>

# Browser caching
<IfModule mod_expires.c>
    ExpiresActive On
    
    # Cache static assets
    ExpiresByType image/jpg "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType image/jpeg "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType image/gif "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType image/png "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType image/webp "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType text/css "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType application/pdf "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType text/javascript "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType application/javascript "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType application/x-javascript "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType application/x-shockwave-flash "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType image/x-icon "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType text/html "access plus 300 seconds"
    
    # Default expiration
    ExpiresDefault "access plus 1 day"
</IfModule>

# Compression
<IfModule mod_deflate.c>
    # Enable compression for text files
    <Location />
        SetOutputFilter DEFLATE
        
        # Don't compress images or binaries
        SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \
            \.(?:gif|jpe?g|png|webp)$ no-gzip dont-vary
        SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \
            \.(?:exe|t?gz|zip|bz2|sit|rar|pdf)$ no-gzip dont-vary
            
        # Include file types to compress
        AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/plain text/xml text/css text/javascript
        AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE application/javascript application/json application/xml application/xhtml+xml application/rss+xml
    </Location>
</IfModule>
EOF
```

## Backup and Maintenance

```bash
sudo tee /usr/local/bin/apache-backup.sh > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
BACKUP_DIR="/backup/apache"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

mkdir -p ${BACKUP_DIR}/{config,logs,sites}

# Detect distribution and set paths
if [ -d /etc/apache2 ]; then
    # Ubuntu/Debian
    CONFIG_DIR="/etc/apache2"
    LOG_DIR="/var/log/apache2"
    SERVICE_NAME="apache2"
elif [ -d /etc/httpd ]; then
    # RHEL/CentOS
    CONFIG_DIR="/etc/httpd"
    LOG_DIR="/var/log/httpd"  
    SERVICE_NAME="httpd"
fi

# Backup configuration
tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/config/apache-config-${DATE}.tar.gz -C / ${CONFIG_DIR#/}

# Backup website files
tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/sites/apache-sites-${DATE}.tar.gz -C /var/www .

# Backup recent logs (last 7 days)
find ${LOG_DIR} -name "*.log" -mtime -7 -exec tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/logs/apache-logs-${DATE}.tar.gz {} +

# Keep only last 7 backups
find ${BACKUP_DIR} -name "apache-*" -type f -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Apache backup completed: ${DATE}"
EOF

sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/apache-backup.sh

# Schedule daily backup
echo "0 2 * * * root /usr/local/bin/apache-backup.sh" | sudo tee -a /etc/crontab
```

Apache HTTP Server Installation Guide

World's most popular web server software serving over 40% of active websites. Reliable, secure, and highly configurable for hosting websites and web applications.

Prerequisites

  • Linux system (any modern distribution)
  • Root or sudo access
  • 1GB RAM minimum, 2GB+ recommended for production
  • Network connectivity for package downloads

    • Installation

    Ubuntu/Debian

    bash 
    # Update package list
sudo apt update

# Install Apache and essential modules
sudo apt install -y apache2 apache2-utils

# Enable essential modules
sudo a2enmod rewrite ssl headers deflate expires security2

sudo systemctl enable --now apache2

sudo systemctl status apache2

    RHEL/CentOS/Rocky Linux/AlmaLinux

    # Install Apache (httpd)

sudo systemctl enable --now httpd

sudo systemctl status httpd

    Fedora

    bash 
    # Install Apache
sudo dnf install -y httpd httpd-tools mod_ssl mod_security

# Start and enable Apache
sudo systemctl enable --now httpd

# Configure firewall
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=http
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=https
sudo firewall-cmd --reload

    Arch Linux

    bash 
    # Install Apache
sudo pacman -Syu apache

# Start and enable Apache

# Uncomment: ServerName www.example.com:80

    openSUSE/SUSE

    Alpine Linux

    bash 
    # Install Apache
sudo apk update
sudo apk add apache2 apache2-ssl apache2-utils

# Create necessary directories

sudo mkdir -p /run/apache2

# Start and enable Apache

    Docker Installation

    bash 
    # Official Apache Docker image
docker run -d \
  --name apache \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 80:80 \
  -p 443:443 \
  -v ~/apache/htdocs:/usr/local/apache2/htdocs/ \
  -v ~/apache/conf:/usr/local/apache2/conf/ \

docker-compose up -d

    Source Compilation (Advanced)

    bash 
    # Install build dependencies
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y build-essential libapr1-dev libaprutil1-dev libpcre3-dev libssl-dev zlib1g-dev

# Download Apache source
cd /tmp
wget https://archive.apache.org/dist/httpd/httpd-2.4.57.tar.gz
tar xzf httpd-2.4.57.tar.gz
cd httpd-2.4.57

# Configure with security and performance modules
./configure \
  --prefix=/etc/apache2 \
  --exec-prefix=/usr \
  --bindir=/usr/bin \
  --sbindir=/usr/sbin \
  --sysconfdir=/etc/apache2 \
  --libexecdir=/usr/lib/apache2/modules \
  --localstatedir=/var \
  --datadir=/usr/share/apache2 \
  --includedir=/usr/include/apache2 \
  --infodir=/usr/share/info \
  --mandir=/usr/share/man \
  --with-program-name=apache2 \
  --enable-layout=Debian \
  --with-regex=pcre \
  --enable-mods-shared=reallyall \
  --enable-ssl \
  --enable-rewrite \
  --enable-headers \
  --enable-deflate \
  --enable-expires \
  --enable-security \
  --with-ssl=/usr \
  --with-ldap \
  --with-ldap-include=/usr/include \
  --with-ldap-lib=/usr/lib

# Compile and install
make -j$(nproc)
sudo make install

# Create apache user
sudo useradd -r -s /sbin/nologin apache

# Create systemd service
sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/apache2.service > /dev/null <<EOF
[Unit]
Description=The Apache HTTP Server

Type=notify

    Security Hardening (2024 Best Practices)

    Hide Server Information

    bash 
    # Create security configuration
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo tee /etc/apache2/conf-available/security-hardening.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Hide Apache version and OS information
ServerTokens Prod
ServerSignature Off

# Hide PHP version (if using PHP)
Header always unset X-Powered-By
Header unset X-Powered-By

# Security headers (2024 recommendations)
Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload"
Header always set X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN"
Header always set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
Header always set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
Header always set Referrer-Policy "strict-origin-when-cross-origin"
Header always set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: https:; font-src 'self' data:; connect-src 'self'; media-src 'self'; object-src 'none'; child-src 'self'; form-action 'self'; base-uri 'self';"

# Remove sensitive headers
Header always unset Server
Header unset Server

# Disable server status and info
<Location "/server-status">
    SetHandler server-status
    Require local
</Location>

<Location "/server-info">
    SetHandler server-info
    Require local
</Location>

# Disable trace method
TraceEnable off

# Timeout configurations
Timeout 60
KeepAliveTimeout 15

# Limit request size (adjust as needed)
LimitRequestBody 10485760  # 10MB

# Hide .htaccess files
<FilesMatch "^\.ht">
    Require all denied
</FilesMatch>

# Hide backup and temporary files
<FilesMatch "\.(bak|backup|swp|tmp|~)$">
    Require all denied
</FilesMatch>

# Disable directory browsing by default
Options -Indexes

# Information disclosure protection
<DirectoryMatch "/\.">
    Require all denied
</DirectoryMatch>

# Clickjacking protection
Header always append X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN
EOF

# Enable security configuration
sudo a2enconf security-hardening
sudo systemctl reload apache2

# RHEL/CentOS (add to main configuration)
sudo tee -a /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf > /dev/null <<EOF

# Security hardening
ServerTokens Prod
ServerSignature Off

# Load security headers module
LoadModule headers_module modules/mod_headers.so

# Security headers
Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload"
Header always set X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN"
Header always set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
Header always set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
Header always set Referrer-Policy "strict-origin-when-cross-origin"

# Disable trace method
TraceEnable off

# Hide .htaccess files
<FilesMatch "^\.ht">
    Require all denied
</FilesMatch>

# Disable directory browsing
Options -Indexes
EOF

sudo systemctl reload httpd

    ModSecurity WAF Installation

    bash 
    # Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y libapache2-mod-security2

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo yum install -y mod_security mod_security_crs

# Enable ModSecurity
sudo a2enmod security2  # Ubuntu/Debian

# Download OWASP Core Rule Set
sudo mkdir -p /etc/apache2/modsecurity.d
cd /etc/apache2/modsecurity.d
sudo wget https://github.com/coreruleset/coreruleset/archive/refs/tags/v3.3.4.tar.gz
sudo tar xzf v3.3.4.tar.gz
sudo mv coreruleset-3.3.4 crs

# Configure ModSecurity
sudo tee /etc/apache2/mods-available/security2.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
<IfModule mod_security2.c>
    SecRuleEngine On
    SecRequestBodyAccess On
    SecRequestBodyLimit 13107200
    SecRequestBodyNoFilesLimit 131072
    SecRequestBodyInMemoryLimit 131072
    SecRequestBodyLimitAction Reject
    SecRule REQUEST_HEADERS:Content-Type "text/xml" \
         "id:'200000',phase:1,t:none,t:lowercase,pass,nolog,ctl:requestBodyProcessor=XML"
    SecRule REQUEST_HEADERS:Content-Type "application/json" \
         "id:'200001',phase:1,t:none,t:lowercase,pass,nolog,ctl:requestBodyProcessor=JSON"

    "id:'200002', phase:2,t:none,log,deny,status:400,msg:'Failed to parse request body.',logdata:'Error %{REQBODY_ERROR_MSG}',severity:2"
    SecRule MULTIPART_STRICT_ERROR "!@eq 0" \
    "id:'200003',phase:2,t:none,log,deny,status:400, \
    msg:'Multipart request body failed strict validation: \
    PE %{REQBODY_PROCESSOR_ERROR}, \
    BQ %{MULTIPART_BOUNDARY_QUOTED}, \
    BW %{MULTIPART_BOUNDARY_WHITESPACE}, \
    DB %{MULTIPART_DATA_BEFORE}, \
    DA %{MULTIPART_DATA_AFTER}, \
    HF %{MULTIPART_HEADER_FOLDING}, \
    LF %{MULTIPART_LF_LINE}, \
    SM %{MULTIPART_MISSING_SEMICOLON}, \
    IQ %{MULTIPART_INVALID_QUOTING}, \
    IP %{MULTIPART_INVALID_PART}, \
    IH %{MULTIPART_INVALID_HEADER_FOLDING}, \

EOF

# Create data directory
sudo mkdir -p /var/cache/modsecurity
sudo chown www-data:www-data /var/cache/modsecurity

    SSL/TLS Configuration (Modern 2024 Standards)

    # Create modern SSL configuration
sudo tee /etc/apache2/conf-available/ssl-modern.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Modern SSL configuration (2024)
SSLEngine on

# Protocols - Only TLS 1.2 and 1.3

# Prefer server ciphers for TLS 1.2, client ciphers for TLS 1.3
SSLHonorCipherOrder off

# HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security)
Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload"

# Modern security options

EOF

    Header always set X-Frame-Options DENY

</VirtualHost>

# HTTPS Virtual Host
<VirtualHost *:443>
    ServerName example.com
    ServerAlias www.example.com
    DocumentRoot /var/www/html/example.com

    SSLEngine on

    SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/privkey.pem
    
    # Security headers (2024 standards)
    Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload"
    Header always set X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN"
    Header always set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
    Header always set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
    Header always set Referrer-Policy "strict-origin-when-cross-origin"
    Header always set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: https:; font-src 'self' data:; connect-src 'self'; media-src 'self'; object-src 'none'; child-src 'self'; form-action 'self'; base-uri 'self';"
    Header always set Permissions-Policy "camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=()"
    
    # Remove server information

    Header unset X-Powered-By
    
    <Directory /var/www/html/example.com>
        Options -Indexes +FollowSymLinks
        AllowOverride All
        Require all granted
        
        # Additional security
        <Files ".*">
            Require all denied
        </Files>
        
        <Files "*.php~">
            Require all denied
        </Files>
        
        <Files "*.inc">
            Require all denied
        </Files>
    </Directory>
    
    # PHP configuration (if using PHP)
    <IfModule mod_php.c>
        php_admin_flag allow_url_include Off
        php_admin_flag allow_url_fopen Off
        php_admin_flag file_uploads On
        php_admin_value upload_max_filesize 64M
        php_admin_value post_max_size 64M
        php_admin_value memory_limit 256M
        php_admin_value max_execution_time 300
        php_admin_flag expose_php Off
    </IfModule>
    
    # Compression
    <IfModule mod_deflate.c>
        SetOutputFilter DEFLATE
        AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/css text/javascript text/xml text/plain application/javascript application/xml+rss application/xml application/x-javascript application/json
        
        # Don't compress images
        SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \.(?:gif|jpe?g|png)$ no-gzip dont-vary
        SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \.(?:exe|t?gz|zip|bz2|sit|rar)$ no-gzip dont-vary
    </IfModule>
    
    # Caching rules
    <IfModule mod_expires.c>
        ExpiresActive On
        ExpiresByType image/jpg "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/jpeg "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/gif "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/png "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/webp "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType text/css "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType application/pdf "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType text/javascript "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType application/javascript "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType application/x-javascript "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType application/x-shockwave-flash "access plus 1 month"
        ExpiresByType image/x-icon "access plus 1 year"
        ExpiresDefault "access plus 2 days"
    </IfModule>
    
    # Rate limiting (if mod_evasive is available)
    <IfModule mod_evasive24.c>
        DOSHashTableSize    1024
        DOSPageCount        2
        DOSSiteCount        50
        DOSPageInterval     1
        DOSSiteInterval     1
        DOSBlockingPeriod   600
        DOSLogDir           /var/log/apache2/
        DOSEmailNotify      admin@example.com
    </IfModule>
    
    # ModSecurity
    <IfModule mod_security2.c>
        SecRuleEngine On
        SecDefaultAction "log,auditlog,pass"
    </IfModule>
    
    ErrorLog \${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/example.com_error.log
    CustomLog \${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/example.com_access.log combined
    
    # Log security events
    CustomLog \${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/example.com_security.log "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-agent}i\"" env=security
</VirtualHost>

# WWW redirect
<VirtualHost *:443>
    ServerName www.example.com
    
    SSLEngine on
    SSLCertificateFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/fullchain.pem
    SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/privkey.pem
    
    Redirect permanent / https://example.com/
</VirtualHost>
EOF

sudo a2ensite secure-site.conf
sudo a2enconf security-hardening
sudo systemctl reload apache2

    Advanced Security Modules

    bash 
    # Install additional security modules
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y libapache2-mod-evasive libapache2-mod-security2

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo yum install -y mod_evasive mod_security

# Enable modules
sudo a2enmod evasive  # Ubuntu/Debian
sudo a2enmod security2

# Configure mod_evasive (DDoS protection)
sudo tee /etc/apache2/mods-available/evasive.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
<IfModule mod_evasive24.c>
    DOSHashTableSize    1024
    DOSPageCount        3
    DOSSiteCount        50
    DOSPageInterval     1
    DOSSiteInterval     1
    DOSBlockingPeriod   600
    DOSLogDir           /var/log/apache2/
    DOSEmailNotify      admin@example.com
    DOSWhitelist        127.0.0.1
    DOSWhitelist        192.168.1.*
</IfModule>
EOF

sudo systemctl reload apache2

    SSL Certificate Setup (Cross-Platform)

    Let's Encrypt Integration

    bash 
    # Install Certbot - Universal method
sudo snap install core; sudo snap refresh core
sudo snap install --classic certbot
sudo ln -s /snap/bin/certbot /usr/bin/certbot

# Alternative: Package manager installation
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y certbot python3-certbot-apache

# RHEL/CentOS (enable EPEL first)
sudo yum install -y epel-release
sudo yum install -y certbot python3-certbot-apache

# Fedora
sudo dnf install -y certbot python3-certbot-apache

# Arch Linux
sudo pacman -S certbot certbot-apache

# Obtain certificate
sudo certbot --apache -d example.com -d www.example.com

# Auto-renewal setup (universal)
sudo crontab -e
# Add: 0 12 * * * /usr/bin/certbot renew --quiet && systemctl reload apache2

# Test renewal
sudo certbot renew --dry-run

    Manual SSL Configuration

    bash 
    # Generate self-signed certificate for testing
sudo mkdir -p /etc/ssl/private
sudo openssl req -x509 -nodes -days 365 -newkey rsa:4096 \
  -keyout /etc/ssl/private/apache-selfsigned.key \
  -out /etc/ssl/certs/apache-selfsigned.crt \
  -subj "/C=US/ST=State/L=City/O=Organization/CN=example.com"

# Create SSL configuration snippet
sudo tee /etc/apache2/conf-available/ssl-params.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Modern SSL configuration
SSLEngine on
SSLProtocol all -SSLv3 -TLSv1 -TLSv1.1
SSLCipherSuite ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
SSLHonorCipherOrder off
SSLSessionTickets off
SSLUseStapling on
SSLStaplingCache shmcb:/var/run/ssl_stapling(32768)
SSLOpenSSLConfCmd DHParameters /etc/ssl/certs/dhparam.pem

# Security headers
Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=63072000; includeSubDomains; preload"
Header always set X-Content-Type-Options nosniff
Header always set X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN
Header always set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
EOF

sudo a2enconf ssl-params

    Firewall Configuration (All Platforms)

    UFW (Ubuntu/Debian)

    bash 
    sudo ufw app list | grep Apache
sudo ufw allow 'Apache Full'    # HTTP and HTTPS
sudo ufw allow 'Apache'         # HTTP only  
sudo ufw allow 'Apache Secure'  # HTTPS only
sudo ufw enable
sudo ufw status

    Firewalld (RHEL/CentOS/Fedora)

    bash 
    sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=http
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=https
sudo firewall-cmd --reload
sudo firewall-cmd --list-services

    iptables (Universal)

    bash 
    # Allow HTTP and HTTPS
sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 80 -j ACCEPT
sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 443 -j ACCEPT

# Save rules (varies by distribution)
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y iptables-persistent
sudo netfilter-persistent save

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo service iptables save

# Arch Linux
sudo iptables-save > /etc/iptables/iptables.rules

# Alpine Linux
sudo /etc/init.d/iptables save

    SELinux Configuration (RHEL/CentOS/Fedora)

    bash 
    # Check SELinux status
getenforce

# Set SELinux booleans for Apache
sudo setsebool -P httpd_can_network_connect 1
sudo setsebool -P httpd_can_network_relay 1
sudo setsebool -P httpd_use_nfs 1
sudo setsebool -P httpd_graceful_shutdown 1

# For custom content directories
sudo semanage fcontext -a -t httpd_exec_t "/var/www/html(/.*)?"
sudo restorecon -Rv /var/www/html/

# For custom ports
sudo semanage port -a -t http_port_t -p tcp 8080

# Check denials
sudo ausearch -m AVC,USER_AVC,SELINUX_ERR -ts recent

    Performance Optimization

    Multi-Processing Module (MPM) Tuning

    bash 
    # Check current MPM
apache2ctl -M | grep mpm  # Ubuntu/Debian
httpd -M | grep mpm       # RHEL/CentOS

# Configure Event MPM (most efficient)
sudo tee /etc/apache2/mods-available/mpm_event.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
<IfModule mpm_event_module>
    StartServers             3
    MinSpareThreads         75
    MaxSpareThreads        250
    ThreadsPerChild         25
    MaxRequestWorkers      400
    MaxConnectionsPerChild   0
    AsyncRequestWorkerFactor 2
</IfModule>
EOF

# Enable Event MPM
sudo a2dismod mpm_prefork
sudo a2enmod mpm_event
sudo systemctl restart apache2

    System-level Performance Tuning

    bash 
    # Increase system limits
sudo tee -a /etc/security/limits.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
apache soft nofile 65535
apache hard nofile 65535
www-data soft nofile 65535
www-data hard nofile 65535
EOF

# Kernel optimization for web servers
sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Apache/web server optimization
net.core.somaxconn = 65535
net.core.netdev_max_backlog = 5000
net.ipv4.tcp_max_syn_backlog = 65535
net.ipv4.tcp_fin_timeout = 10
net.ipv4.tcp_tw_reuse = 1
net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range = 15000 65000
fs.file-max = 100000

# Memory management
vm.swappiness = 10
vm.dirty_ratio = 15
vm.dirty_background_ratio = 5
EOF

sudo sysctl -p

    Caching Configuration

    bash 
    # Enable caching modules
sudo a2enmod cache cache_disk expires headers

# Create cache configuration
sudo tee /etc/apache2/conf-available/caching.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
# Disk cache configuration
<IfModule mod_cache_disk.c>
    CacheRoot /var/cache/apache2/mod_cache_disk
    CacheDirLevels 2
    CacheDirLength 1
    CacheEnable disk /
    CacheIgnoreHeaders Set-Cookie
    CacheDefaultExpire 3600
    CacheMaxExpire 86400
    CacheLastModifiedFactor 0.1
</IfModule>

# Browser caching
<IfModule mod_expires.c>
    ExpiresActive On
    
    # Cache static assets
    ExpiresByType image/jpg "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType image/jpeg "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType image/gif "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType image/png "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType image/webp "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType text/css "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType application/pdf "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType text/javascript "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType application/javascript "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType application/x-javascript "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType application/x-shockwave-flash "access plus 1 month"
    ExpiresByType image/x-icon "access plus 1 year"
    ExpiresByType text/html "access plus 300 seconds"
    
    # Default expiration
    ExpiresDefault "access plus 1 day"
</IfModule>

# Compression
<IfModule mod_deflate.c>
    # Enable compression for text files
    <Location />
        SetOutputFilter DEFLATE
        
        # Don't compress images or binaries
        SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \
            \.(?:gif|jpe?g|png|webp)$ no-gzip dont-vary
        SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \
            \.(?:exe|t?gz|zip|bz2|sit|rar|pdf)$ no-gzip dont-vary
            
        # Include file types to compress
        AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/plain text/xml text/css text/javascript
        AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE application/javascript application/json application/xml application/xhtml+xml application/rss+xml
    </Location>
</IfModule>
EOF

# Create cache directory
sudo mkdir -p /var/cache/apache2/mod_cache_disk
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /var/cache/apache2  # Ubuntu/Debian
sudo chown -R apache:apache /var/cache/apache2      # RHEL/CentOS

sudo a2enconf caching
sudo systemctl reload apache2

    Cross-Platform Verification

    Service Management (All Distributions)

    bash 
    # Check which init system is in use
if command -v systemctl &> /dev/null; then
    echo "Using systemd"
    
    # SystemD commands
    sudo systemctl status apache2    # Ubuntu/Debian
    sudo systemctl status httpd      # RHEL/CentOS
    sudo systemctl restart apache2
    sudo systemctl reload apache2
    
elif command -v service &> /dev/null; then
    echo "Using SysV init"
    
    # Traditional service commands
    sudo service apache2 status
    sudo service apache2 restart
    sudo service apache2 reload
    
elif command -v rc-service &> /dev/null; then
    echo "Using OpenRC (Alpine)"
    
    # OpenRC commands
    sudo rc-service apache2 status
    sudo rc-service apache2 restart
fi

    Configuration Testing

    bash 
    # Test configuration syntax (distribution-aware)
if [ -f /etc/apache2/apache2.conf ]; then
    # Ubuntu/Debian
    sudo apache2ctl configtest
    sudo apache2ctl -S  # Show virtual hosts
    sudo apache2ctl -M  # Show loaded modules
elif [ -f /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf ]; then
    # RHEL/CentOS
    sudo httpd -t
    sudo httpd -S
    sudo httpd -M
fi

# Show version and build info
apache2ctl -v  # Ubuntu/Debian
httpd -v       # RHEL/CentOS

# Show all configuration
apache2ctl -T  # Ubuntu/Debian
httpd -T       # RHEL/CentOS

    Log Analysis and Monitoring

    bash 
    # Monitor Apache logs (cross-platform)
# Ubuntu/Debian paths
sudo tail -f /var/log/apache2/access.log
sudo tail -f /var/log/apache2/error.log

# RHEL/CentOS paths  
sudo tail -f /var/log/httpd/access_log
sudo tail -f /var/log/httpd/error_log

# Real-time connection monitoring
watch "netstat -an | grep :80 | grep ESTABLISHED | wc -l"

# Monitor process performance
htop -p $(pgrep apache2 || pgrep httpd | head -5 | tr '\n' ',' | sed 's/,$//')

# Check virtual host access
sudo grep "GET\|POST" /var/log/apache2/access.log | tail -20  # Ubuntu/Debian
sudo grep "GET\|POST" /var/log/httpd/access_log | tail -20    # RHEL/CentOS

    Cross-Platform Troubleshooting

    Common Issues and Solutions

    bash 
    # Check which user Apache runs as
ps aux | grep -E "(apache2|httpd)" | grep -v grep

# Permission issues (distribution-aware)
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www/html
sudo chmod -R 755 /var/www/html

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo chown -R apache:apache /var/www/html
sudo chmod -R 755 /var/www/html

# Check configuration file locations
if [ -d /etc/apache2 ]; then
    echo "Configuration directory: /etc/apache2"
    echo "Main config: /etc/apache2/apache2.conf"
    echo "Sites: /etc/apache2/sites-available/"
elif [ -d /etc/httpd ]; then
    echo "Configuration directory: /etc/httpd"
    echo "Main config: /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf"
    echo "Virtual hosts: /etc/httpd/conf.d/"
fi

# Port binding issues
sudo lsof -i :80
sudo netstat -tulpn | grep :80

# SELinux troubleshooting (RHEL/CentOS)
if command -v getenforce &> /dev/null; then
    echo "SELinux status: $(getenforce)"
    sudo ausearch -m AVC,USER_AVC -ts recent
    sudo grep "denied" /var/log/audit/audit.log | tail -5
fi

# Check Apache error logs for issues
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo tail -20 /var/log/apache2/error.log

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo tail -20 /var/log/httpd/error_log

# Test specific virtual host
curl -H "Host: example.com" http://localhost/

# Check loaded modules
apache2ctl -M | grep -E "(rewrite|ssl|headers)"  # Ubuntu/Debian
httpd -M | grep -E "(rewrite|ssl|headers)"        # RHEL/CentOS

# Memory usage analysis
ps aux --sort=-%mem | grep -E "(apache2|httpd)" | head -10

    Debug Mode and Advanced Troubleshooting

    bash 
    # Enable debug logging
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo nano /etc/apache2/apache2.conf
# Add: LogLevel debug

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo nano /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf
# Add: LogLevel debug

# Test configuration with specific user
sudo -u www-data apache2ctl configtest  # Ubuntu/Debian
sudo -u apache httpd -t                  # RHEL/CentOS

# Check virtual host configuration
apache2ctl -S  # Ubuntu/Debian
httpd -S       # RHEL/CentOS

# Trace requests (careful in production)
# Add to virtual host:
LogLevel debug
CustomLog /var/log/apache2/trace.log "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-agent}i\" %D"

# Monitor real-time
sudo tail -f /var/log/apache2/trace.log

    Additional Security Tools Integration

    Fail2Ban Configuration

    bash 
    # Install Fail2Ban
sudo apt install -y fail2ban  # Ubuntu/Debian
sudo yum install -y fail2ban  # RHEL/CentOS

# Create Apache-specific jails
sudo tee /etc/fail2ban/jail.d/apache.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
[apache-auth]
enabled = true
port = http,https
filter = apache-auth
logpath = /var/log/apache2/error.log  # Ubuntu/Debian
# logpath = /var/log/httpd/error_log  # RHEL/CentOS
maxretry = 6
findtime = 600
bantime = 3600

[apache-badbots]
enabled = true
port = http,https
filter = apache-badbots  
logpath = /var/log/apache2/access.log  # Ubuntu/Debian
# logpath = /var/log/httpd/access_log  # RHEL/CentOS
maxretry = 2
bantime = 86400

[apache-noscript]
enabled = true
port = http,https
filter = apache-noscript
logpath = /var/log/apache2/access.log  # Ubuntu/Debian
# logpath = /var/log/httpd/access_log  # RHEL/CentOS
maxretry = 6
bantime = 86400

[apache-overflows]
enabled = true
port = http,https
filter = apache-overflows
logpath = /var/log/apache2/error.log  # Ubuntu/Debian
# logpath = /var/log/httpd/error_log  # RHEL/CentOS
maxretry = 2
bantime = 86400
EOF

sudo systemctl enable --now fail2ban

    Log Analysis and Monitoring

    bash 
    # Install GoAccess for real-time log analysis
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install -y goaccess

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo yum install -y goaccess

# Analyze logs in real-time
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo goaccess /var/log/apache2/access.log -c

# RHEL/CentOS
sudo goaccess /var/log/httpd/access_log -c

# Generate HTML report
sudo goaccess /var/log/apache2/access.log -o /var/www/html/stats.html --log-format=COMBINED --real-time-html

    Backup and Maintenance

    Automated Backup Script

    bash 
    sudo tee /usr/local/bin/apache-backup.sh > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
BACKUP_DIR="/backup/apache"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

mkdir -p ${BACKUP_DIR}/{config,logs,sites}

# Detect distribution and set paths
if [ -d /etc/apache2 ]; then
    # Ubuntu/Debian
    CONFIG_DIR="/etc/apache2"
    LOG_DIR="/var/log/apache2"
    SERVICE_NAME="apache2"
elif [ -d /etc/httpd ]; then
    # RHEL/CentOS
    CONFIG_DIR="/etc/httpd"
    LOG_DIR="/var/log/httpd"  
    SERVICE_NAME="httpd"
fi

# Backup configuration
tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/config/apache-config-${DATE}.tar.gz -C / ${CONFIG_DIR#/}

# Backup website files
tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/sites/apache-sites-${DATE}.tar.gz -C /var/www .

# Backup recent logs (last 7 days)
find ${LOG_DIR} -name "*.log" -mtime -7 -exec tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/logs/apache-logs-${DATE}.tar.gz {} +

# Keep only last 7 backups
find ${BACKUP_DIR} -name "apache-*" -type f -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Apache backup completed: ${DATE}"
EOF

sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/apache-backup.sh

# Schedule daily backup
echo "0 2 * * * root /usr/local/bin/apache-backup.sh" | sudo tee -a /etc/crontab

    This updated Apache guide now includes:

  • âœ… Complete cross-platform support (Ubuntu, Debian, RHEL, CentOS, Rocky, Fedora, Arch, openSUSE, Alpine)
  • âœ… 2024 security best practices (modern SSL/TLS, security headers, ModSecurity WAF)
  • âœ… Performance optimization (MPM tuning, system optimization, caching)
  • âœ… Advanced configurations (virtual hosts, SSL certificates, compression)
  • âœ… Comprehensive troubleshooting (SELinux, cross-platform debugging)
  • âœ… Security tools integration (Fail2Ban, log analysis, monitoring)

guides.readmeRaw:
# Database Installation Guide

Installation instructions for popular database systems including MySQL/MariaDB, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and more.

## Prerequisites

- RHEL/CentOS 7+ or compatible Linux distribution
- Root or sudo access
- Sufficient disk space for database storage

## MariaDB/MySQL

### Installation
```bash
# Add MariaDB repository
echo '[mariadb]
name = MariaDB
baseurl = https://mirror.its.dal.ca/mariadb/yum/10.6/centos$releasever-$basearch
module_hotfixes=1
gpgkey=https://mirror.its.dal.ca/mariadb/yum/RPM-GPG-KEY-MariaDB
gpgcheck=1' | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/MariaDB.repo

# Install MariaDB
sudo yum install -y mariadb-server mariadb
sudo systemctl enable --now mariadb

# Secure installation
sudo mysql_secure_installation
```

## PostgreSQL

### Installation
```bash
# Install PostgreSQL repository
sudo yum install -y https://download.postgresql.org/pub/repos/yum/reporpms/EL-7-x86_64/pgdg-redhat-repo-latest.noarch.rpm

# Install PostgreSQL
sudo yum install -y postgresql13-server postgresql13
sudo /usr/pgsql-13/bin/postgresql-13-setup initdb
sudo systemctl enable --now postgresql-13

# Configure authentication
sudo -u postgres psql
postgres=# CREATE USER myuser WITH PASSWORD 'mypassword';
postgres=# CREATE DATABASE mydb OWNER myuser;
postgres=# \q
```

## MongoDB

### Installation
```bash
# Add MongoDB repository
echo '[mongodb-org-5.0]
name=MongoDB Repository
baseurl=https://repo.mongodb.org/yum/redhat/$releasever/mongodb-org/5.0/$basearch/
gpgcheck=1
enabled=1
gpgkey=https://www.mongodb.org/static/pgp/server-5.0.asc' | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/mongodb-org-5.0.repo

# Install MongoDB
sudo yum install -y mongodb-org
sudo systemctl enable --now mongod
```

## Microsoft SQL Server

### Installation
```bash
# Add Microsoft repository
echo '[packages-microsoft-com-mssql-server-2019]
name=packages-microsoft-com-mssql-server-2019
baseurl=https://packages.microsoft.com/rhel/$releasever/mssql-server-2019/
enabled=1
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc' | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/mssql-server.repo

# Install SQL Server
sudo yum install -y mssql-server
sudo /opt/mssql/bin/mssql-conf setup
sudo systemctl enable --now mssql-server
```

## CouchDB

### Installation
```bash
# Add CouchDB repository
echo '[bintray--apache-couchdb-rpm]
name=bintray--apache-couchdb-rpm
baseurl=http://apache.bintray.com/couchdb-rpm/el$releasever/$basearch/
gpgcheck=0
repo_gpgcheck=0
enabled=1' | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/apache-couchdb.repo

# Install CouchDB
sudo yum install -y couchdb
sudo systemctl enable --now couchdb
```

## Configuration

### Firewall Setup
```bash
# MariaDB/MySQL
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=mysql
# PostgreSQL
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=5432/tcp
# MongoDB
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=27017/tcp
# SQL Server
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=1433/tcp
# CouchDB
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=5984/tcp

sudo firewall-cmd --reload
```

## Verification

```bash
# MariaDB/MySQL
mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT VERSION();"

# PostgreSQL
sudo -u postgres psql -c "SELECT version();"

# MongoDB
mongosh --eval "db.version()"

# SQL Server
sqlcmd -S localhost -U SA -P 'YourPassword' -Q 'SELECT @@VERSION'

# CouchDB
curl http://localhost:5984/
```

## Usage

Each database system has different management approaches:

1. **MariaDB/MySQL**: Use `mysql` command-line client or phpMyAdmin
2. **PostgreSQL**: Use `psql` command-line client or pgAdmin
3. **MongoDB**: Use `mongosh` shell or MongoDB Compass
4. **SQL Server**: Use `sqlcmd` or SQL Server Management Studio
5. **CouchDB**: Use web interface at http://localhost:5984/_utils

## Additional Resources

- [MariaDB Documentation](https://mariadb.com/docs/)
- [PostgreSQL Documentation](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/)
- [MongoDB Documentation](https://docs.mongodb.com/)
- [SQL Server on Linux](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/linux/)
- [CouchDB Documentation](https://docs.couchdb.org/)

guides.readmeRaw:
# Docker Installation Guide

Containerization platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in isolated environments.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system with kernel 3.10+
- 64-bit architecture
- Root or sudo access

## Installation

### Quick Installation Script
```bash
# Install Docker using official script
curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh
sudo sh get-docker.sh

# Add current user to docker group
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
newgrp docker

# Enable Docker service
sudo systemctl enable --now docker
```

### Manual Installation (RHEL/CentOS)
```bash
# Install prerequisites
sudo yum install -y yum-utils device-mapper-persistent-data lvm2

# Add Docker repository
sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo https://download.docker.com/linux/centos/docker-ce.repo

# Install Docker
sudo yum install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io

# Start Docker
sudo systemctl enable --now docker
```

## Configuration

### Docker Compose Installation
```bash
# Download Docker Compose
sudo curl -L "https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/latest/download/docker-compose-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m)" -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose

# Make executable
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose

# Create symlink (optional)
sudo ln -s /usr/local/bin/docker-compose /usr/bin/docker-compose
```

### Docker Machine (Optional)
```bash
# Download Docker Machine
base=https://github.com/docker/machine/releases/download/v0.16.2
curl -L $base/docker-machine-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m) >/tmp/docker-machine
sudo mv /tmp/docker-machine /usr/local/bin/docker-machine
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-machine

# Install bash completion
base=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/docker/machine/v0.16.2
for i in docker-machine-prompt.bash docker-machine-wrapper.bash docker-machine.bash; do
  sudo wget "$base/contrib/completion/bash/${i}" -P /etc/bash_completion.d
done
```

## Portainer Installation (Optional)
```bash
# Create volume and run Portainer
docker volume create portainer_data
docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 \
    --name portainer --restart=always \
    -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
    -v portainer_data:/data \
    portainer/portainer-ce:latest
```

## Verification

```bash
# Check Docker version
docker --version
docker-compose --version

# Test Docker installation
docker run hello-world

# Check Docker service status
sudo systemctl status docker

# List Docker images and containers
docker images
docker ps -a
```

## Usage

Basic Docker commands:

1. **Pull an image**: `docker pull nginx`
2. **Run a container**: `docker run -d -p 80:80 nginx`
3. **List containers**: `docker ps`
4. **Stop container**: `docker stop container_id`
5. **Remove container**: `docker rm container_id`

## Additional Resources

- [Official Documentation](https://docs.docker.com/)
- [Docker Hub](https://hub.docker.com/)
- [Docker Compose Documentation](https://docs.docker.com/compose/)
- [Portainer Documentation](https://documentation.portainer.io/)

---

**Note:** This guide is part of the [HowToMgr](https://howtomgr.github.io) collection.

guides.readmeRaw:
# GitLab Installation Guide

Complete DevOps platform with Git repository management, CI/CD pipelines, issue tracking, and container registry.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS, or compatible)
- 8GB RAM minimum, 16GB+ recommended for production
- 4 CPU cores minimum
- 20GB+ available disk space
- Domain name for external access

## Installation

### Using Omnibus Package (Recommended)

#### Ubuntu/Debian
```bash
# Install dependencies
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl openssh-server postfix

# Add GitLab repository
curl -fsSL https://packages.gitlab.com/install/repositories/gitlab/gitlab-ee/script.deb.sh | sudo bash

# Install GitLab
sudo apt install -y gitlab-ee

# Configure and start GitLab
sudo gitlab-ctl reconfigure
```

#### RHEL/CentOS/Rocky Linux
```bash
# Install dependencies
sudo yum install -y curl policycoreutils-python-utils openssh-server postfix

# Enable SSH and Postfix
sudo systemctl enable --now sshd postfix

# Add GitLab repository
curl -fsSL https://packages.gitlab.com/install/repositories/gitlab/gitlab-ee/script.rpm.sh | sudo bash

# Install GitLab
sudo yum install -y gitlab-ee

# Configure and start GitLab
sudo gitlab-ctl reconfigure
```

### Using Docker Compose
```bash
# Create GitLab directory
mkdir -p ~/gitlab/{config,logs,data}
cd ~/gitlab

# Set proper ownership
sudo chown -R 998:998 config logs data

# Create docker-compose.yml
cat > docker-compose.yml <<EOF
version: '3.8'

services:
  gitlab:
    image: gitlab/gitlab-ee:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    hostname: gitlab.example.com
    environment:
      GITLAB_OMNIBUS_CONFIG: |
        external_url 'https://gitlab.example.com'
        
        # GitLab configuration
        gitlab_rails['gitlab_shell_ssh_port'] = 2222
        gitlab_rails['time_zone'] = 'America/New_York'
        gitlab_rails['gitlab_email_enabled'] = true
        gitlab_rails['gitlab_email_from'] = 'gitlab@example.com'
        gitlab_rails['gitlab_email_display_name'] = 'GitLab'
        
        # Database configuration
        postgresql['shared_preload_libraries'] = 'pg_stat_statements'
        postgresql['track_activity_query_size'] = 1024
        
        # Redis configuration
        redis['save'] = '900 1 300 10 60 10000'
        
        # Backup configuration
        gitlab_rails['backup_keep_time'] = 604800  # 7 days
        
        # Container Registry
        registry_external_url 'https://registry.example.com'
        gitlab_rails['registry_enabled'] = true
        
        # Monitoring
        prometheus_monitoring['enable'] = true
        grafana['enable'] = true
        
        # NGINX
        nginx['listen_port'] = 80
        nginx['listen_https'] = false
        nginx['redirect_http_to_https'] = false
        
        # Let's Encrypt (disable for reverse proxy setup)
        letsencrypt['enable'] = false
        
    ports:
      - '80:80'
      - '443:443'
      - '2222:22'
    volumes:
      - './config:/etc/gitlab'
      - './logs:/var/log/gitlab'
      - './data:/var/opt/gitlab'
    shm_size: '256m'
    networks:
      - gitlab

networks:
  gitlab:
    driver: bridge
EOF

# Start GitLab
docker-compose up -d

# Check logs
docker-compose logs -f gitlab
```

## Configuration

### Basic Configuration (/etc/gitlab/gitlab.rb)
```bash
# Edit GitLab configuration
sudo nano /etc/gitlab/gitlab.rb

# Key settings:
external_url 'https://gitlab.example.com'

# Email configuration
gitlab_rails['smtp_enable'] = true
gitlab_rails['smtp_address'] = "smtp.example.com"
gitlab_rails['smtp_port'] = 587
gitlab_rails['smtp_user_name'] = "smtp_username"
gitlab_rails['smtp_password'] = "smtp_password"
gitlab_rails['smtp_domain'] = "example.com"
gitlab_rails['smtp_authentication'] = "login"
gitlab_rails['smtp_enable_starttls_auto'] = true
gitlab_rails['smtp_tls'] = false

gitlab_rails['gitlab_email_from'] = 'gitlab@example.com'
gitlab_rails['gitlab_email_display_name'] = 'GitLab'

# Backup configuration
gitlab_rails['backup_keep_time'] = 604800  # 7 days
gitlab_rails['backup_upload_connection'] = {
  'provider' => 'AWS',
```

### NGINX Reverse Proxy (External)
```bash

upstream gitlab-workhorse {

}

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name gitlab.example.com;
  return 301 https://\$server_name\$request_uri;
}

server {
  listen 443 ssl http2;
  server_name gitlab.example.com;

  ssl_certificate /etc/ssl/certs/gitlab.crt;
  ssl_certificate_key /etc/ssl/private/gitlab.key;

  location / {
    proxy_pass http://gitlab-workhorse;
    proxy_set_header Host \$http_host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP \$remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For \$proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto \$scheme;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Ssl on;
    
    # GitLab specific headers
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Host \$http_host;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Server \$host;
    
    # WebSocket support
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade \$http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";

    proxy_send_timeout 60s;
    proxy_read_timeout 60s;
  }

  server_name registry.example.com;
```

## GitLab Runner Setup



## Backup and Restore

### Automated Backup
```bash
# Configure automatic backups
sudo tee -a /etc/gitlab/gitlab.rb > /dev/null <<EOF

# Backup settings
gitlab_rails['backup_keep_time'] = 604800  # 7 days
gitlab_rails['backup_path'] = "/var/opt/gitlab/backups"

# S3 backup upload
gitlab_rails['backup_upload_connection'] = {
  'provider' => 'AWS',
  'region' => 'us-east-1',
  'aws_access_key_id' => 'your_access_key',
  'aws_secret_access_key' => 'your_secret_key'
}
gitlab_rails['backup_upload_remote_directory'] = 'gitlab-backups'
gitlab_rails['backup_multipart_chunk_size'] = 104857600  # 100MB
gitlab_rails['backup_encryption'] = 'AES256'
EOF

sudo gitlab-ctl reconfigure

# Create backup script
sudo tee /usr/local/bin/gitlab-backup.sh > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Create GitLab backup
gitlab-backup create STRATEGY=copy

# Backup configuration files
tar -czf /var/opt/gitlab/backups/$(date +%s_%Y_%m_%d)_gitlab_config_backup.tar.gz -C / etc/gitlab/gitlab-secrets.json etc/gitlab/gitlab.rb

echo "GitLab backup completed"
EOF

sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/gitlab-backup.sh

# Schedule daily backup
echo "0 2 * * * root /usr/local/bin/gitlab-backup.sh" | sudo tee -a /etc/crontab
```
