# Node.js Installation Guide

JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. Essential for running JavaScript applications on servers.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS/Fedora, or Arch)
- curl or wget for downloading packages

## Installation

### Using NVM (Recommended)
```bash
# Install NVM
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.35.3/install.sh | bash
source ~/.bashrc

# Install latest Node.js
nvm install node
nvm use node

# Install LTS version
nvm install --lts
nvm use --lts

# Install specific version
nvm install v18.17.0
nvm use v18.17.0
```

### System Package Installation

#### Ubuntu/Debian
```bash
# Install build essentials
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y build-essential

# Add NodeSource repository
curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_18.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs
```

#### RHEL/CentOS/Fedora
```bash
# Install development tools
sudo yum groupinstall 'Development Tools'

# Add NodeSource repository  
curl -sL https://rpm.nodesource.com/setup_18.x | sudo bash -
sudo yum install -y nodejs npm
```

#### Arch Linux
```bash
# Install from official repositories
sudo pacman -S nodejs npm
```

## Configuration

### NGINX Proxy Setup
```bash
# Create NGINX configuration
sudo tee /etc/nginx/sites-available/nodejs-app > /dev/null <<EOF
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name your-domain.com;
    
    location / {
        proxy_pass http://localhost:3000;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade \$http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection 'upgrade';
        proxy_set_header Host \$host;
        proxy_cache_bypass \$http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP \$remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For \$proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto \$scheme;
    }
}
EOF

# Enable site
sudo ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/nodejs-app /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/
sudo nginx -t && sudo systemctl restart nginx
```

### SystemD Service
```bash
# Create systemd service for your app
sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/myapp.service > /dev/null <<EOF
[Unit]
Description=Node.js App
After=network.target

[Service]
Type=simple
User=www-data
WorkingDirectory=/path/to/your/app
ExecStart=/usr/bin/node app.js
Restart=on-failure
RestartSec=10
Environment=NODE_ENV=production
Environment=PORT=3000

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
EOF

# Enable and start service
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl enable --now myapp
```

## Verification

```bash
# Check Node.js version
node --version
npm --version

# Test basic functionality
node -e "console.log('Node.js is working!')"

# Check service status (if using systemd)
sudo systemctl status myapp
```

## Usage

1. Create your Node.js application
2. Install dependencies with `npm install`
3. Start development server with `npm start` or `node app.js`
4. For production, use PM2 or systemd service
5. Configure reverse proxy with NGINX

## Additional Resources

- [Official Documentation](https://nodejs.org/docs/)
- [NPM Documentation](https://docs.npmjs.com/)
- [NVM GitHub](https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm)

---

**Note:** This guide is part of the [HowToMgr](https://howtomgr.github.io) collection.

guides.readmeRaw:
# Prometheus Installation Guide

Open-source monitoring and alerting toolkit. Collects and stores metrics as time series data for monitoring system performance.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS, or compatible)
- Root or sudo access
- 4GB RAM minimum, 8GB recommended for production
- Persistent storage for time series data

## Installation

### Using Pre-compiled Binaries
```bash
# Create prometheus user
sudo useradd --no-create-home --shell /bin/false prometheus

# Create directories
sudo mkdir -p /etc/prometheus /var/lib/prometheus
sudo chown prometheus:prometheus /etc/prometheus /var/lib/prometheus

# Download and install Prometheus
cd /tmp
wget https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus/releases/download/v2.45.0/prometheus-2.45.0.linux-amd64.tar.gz
tar xzf prometheus-2.45.0.linux-amd64.tar.gz
cd prometheus-2.45.0.linux-amd64

# Copy binaries
sudo cp prometheus promtool /usr/local/bin/
sudo chown prometheus:prometheus /usr/local/bin/prometheus /usr/local/bin/promtool

# Copy configuration files
sudo cp -r consoles console_libraries /etc/prometheus/
sudo chown -R prometheus:prometheus /etc/prometheus/consoles /etc/prometheus/console_libraries
```

### Using Package Manager (Ubuntu/Debian)
```bash
# Add Prometheus APT repository
wget -qO - https://packages.grafana.com/gpg.key | sudo apt-key add -
echo "deb https://packages.grafana.com/oss/deb stable main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/grafana.list

# Install Prometheus
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y prometheus

# Start and enable Prometheus
sudo systemctl enable --now prometheus
```

### Using Docker
```bash
# Create directories for persistent data
mkdir -p ~/prometheus/data ~/prometheus/config

# Create basic configuration
cat > ~/prometheus/config/prometheus.yml <<EOF
global:
  scrape_interval: 15s
  evaluation_interval: 15s

rule_files:
  # - "first_rules.yml"
  # - "second_rules.yml"

scrape_configs:
  - job_name: 'prometheus'
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['localhost:9090']

  - job_name: 'node'
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['localhost:9100']
EOF

# Run Prometheus container
docker run -d \
  --name prometheus \
  -p 9090:9090 \
  -v ~/prometheus/config/prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml \
  -v ~/prometheus/data:/prometheus \
  prom/prometheus:latest \
  --config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml \
  --storage.tsdb.path=/prometheus \
  --web.console.libraries=/etc/prometheus/console_libraries \
  --web.console.templates=/etc/prometheus/consoles \
  --storage.tsdb.retention.time=200h \
  --web.enable-lifecycle
```

## Configuration

### Basic Configuration
```bash
# Create main configuration file
sudo tee /etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml > /dev/null <<EOF
global:
  scrape_interval:     15s
  evaluation_interval: 15s

alerting:
  alertmanagers:
    - static_configs:
        - targets:
          # - alertmanager:9093

rule_files:
  - "/etc/prometheus/rules/*.yml"

scrape_configs:
  - job_name: 'prometheus'
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['localhost:9090']

  - job_name: 'node-exporter'
    static_configs:
      - targets: 
        - 'localhost:9100'
        - '192.168.1.10:9100'
        - '192.168.1.11:9100'

  - job_name: 'blackbox'
    metrics_path: /probe
    params:
      module: [http_2xx]
    static_configs:
      - targets:
        - https://example.com
        - https://google.com
    relabel_configs:
      - source_labels: [__address__]
        target_label: __param_target
      - source_labels: [__param_target]
        target_label: instance
      - target_label: __address__
        replacement: localhost:9115

  - job_name: 'nginx-exporter'
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['localhost:9113']

  - job_name: 'mysql-exporter'
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['localhost:9104']
EOF
```

## Alerting Rules

```bash
# Create rules directory

sudo chown prometheus:prometheus /etc/prometheus/rules

# Create basic alerting rules

groups:
- name: basic.rules
  rules:
  - alert: InstanceDown
    expr: up == 0
    for: 1m
    labels:
      severity: critical
    annotations:
      summary: "Instance {{ \$labels.instance }} down"
      description: "{{ \$labels.instance }} of job {{ \$labels.job }} has been down for more than 1 minute."

  - alert: HighCpuLoad
    expr: 100 - (avg by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"}[5m])) * 100) > 80
    for: 2m
    labels:
      severity: warning
    annotations:
      summary: "High CPU load (instance {{ \$labels.instance }})"
      description: "CPU load is > 80%\n  VALUE = {{ \$value }}\n  LABELS: {{ \$labels }}"

  - alert: HighMemoryLoad
    expr: (sum(node_memory_MemTotal_bytes) - sum(node_memory_MemFree_bytes + node_memory_Buffers_bytes + node_memory_Cached_bytes) ) / sum(node_memory_MemTotal_bytes) * 100 > 80
    for: 2m
    labels:
      severity: warning
    annotations:
      summary: "High memory load (instance {{ \$labels.instance }})"
      description: "Memory load is > 80%\n  VALUE = {{ \$value }}\n  LABELS: {{ \$labels }}"

  - alert: HighDiskLoad
    expr: 100 - ((node_filesystem_avail_bytes{mountpoint="/",fstype!="rootfs"} * 100) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{mountpoint="/",fstype!="rootfs"}) > 85
    for: 2m
    labels:
      severity: warning
    annotations:
      summary: "High disk load (instance {{ \$labels.instance }})"
      description: "Disk load is > 85%\n  VALUE = {{ \$value }}\n  LABELS: {{ \$labels }}"

  - alert: ServiceDown
    expr: node_systemd_unit_state{state="active"} == 0
    for: 1m
    labels:
      severity: critical
    annotations:
      summary: "Service {{ \$labels.name }} down on {{ \$labels.instance }}"
      description: "Service {{ \$labels.name }} is down on {{ \$labels.instance }}"
```

## Backup and Restore

```bash
# Create backup script
sudo tee /usr/local/bin/prometheus-backup.sh > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
BACKUP_DIR="/backup/prometheus"
PROMETHEUS_DATA="/var/lib/prometheus"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

mkdir -p ${BACKUP_DIR}

# Stop Prometheus
systemctl stop prometheus

# Create backup
tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/prometheus_backup_${DATE}.tar.gz -C ${PROMETHEUS_DATA} .

# Start Prometheus
systemctl start prometheus

# Keep only last 7 backups
find ${BACKUP_DIR} -name "prometheus_backup_*.tar.gz" -type f -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed: prometheus_backup_${DATE}.tar.gz"
EOF

sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/prometheus-backup.sh

# Schedule daily backup
echo "0 2 * * * root /usr/local/bin/prometheus-backup.sh" | sudo tee -a /etc/crontab
```

sudo systemctl enable --now mysql-exporter

    Performance Tuning

    bash 
    # Update Prometheus configuration for performance
sudo tee -a /etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml > /dev/null <<EOF

global:
  scrape_interval:     30s
  evaluation_interval: 30s
  external_labels:
    cluster: 'production'
    replica: 'prometheus-01'

# Performance settings for systemd service
sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/prometheus.service.d/performance.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
[Service]
ExecStart=
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/prometheus \
    --config.file /etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml \
    --storage.tsdb.path /var/lib/prometheus/ \
    --web.console.libraries=/etc/prometheus/console_libraries \
    --web.console.templates=/etc/prometheus/consoles \
    --storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d \
    --storage.tsdb.retention.size=50GB \
    --storage.tsdb.wal-compression \
    --web.enable-lifecycle \
    --web.enable-admin-api
EOF

sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl restart prometheus

    Backup and Restore

    bash 
    # Create backup script
sudo tee /usr/local/bin/prometheus-backup.sh > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
BACKUP_DIR="/backup/prometheus"
PROMETHEUS_DATA="/var/lib/prometheus"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

mkdir -p ${BACKUP_DIR}

# Stop Prometheus
systemctl stop prometheus

# Create backup
tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/prometheus_backup_${DATE}.tar.gz -C ${PROMETHEUS_DATA} .

# Start Prometheus
systemctl start prometheus

# Keep only last 7 backups
find ${BACKUP_DIR} -name "prometheus_backup_*.tar.gz" -type f -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed: prometheus_backup_${DATE}.tar.gz"
EOF

sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/prometheus-backup.sh

# Schedule daily backup
echo "0 2 * * * root /usr/local/bin/prometheus-backup.sh" | sudo tee -a /etc/crontab

    Troubleshooting

    bash 
    # Check Prometheus logs
sudo journalctl -u prometheus -f

# Check Node Exporter logs
sudo journalctl -u node_exporter -f

# Verify configuration syntax
sudo -u prometheus /usr/local/bin/promtool check config /etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml

# Check rule syntax
sudo -u prometheus /usr/local/bin/promtool check rules /etc/prometheus/rules/*.yml

# Test specific target connectivity
curl -m 5 http://192.168.1.10:9100/metrics

# Check disk space usage
du -sh /var/lib/prometheus/

# View current configuration
curl http://localhost:9090/api/v1/status/config

# Reload configuration without restart
curl -X POST http://localhost:9090/-/reload

    Additional Resources

  • Official Documentation
  • Prometheus Configuration
  • Alerting Rules
  • Best Practices
  • Exporters and Integrations

# Install docker

### ZFS

```shell
zfs create -o mountpoint=/var/lib/docker rpool/docker
mkdir /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d
curl -q -LSs https://github.com/casjay-base/howtos/raw/main/proxmox/storage-driver.conf >/etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/storage-driver.conf
```

### Docker

```shell
apt-get install -y apt-transport-https ca-certificates curl gnupg2 software-properties-common
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/debian/gpg | apt-key add -
apt-key fingerprint 0EBFCD88
add-apt-repository "deb [arch=amd64] https://download.docker.com/linux/debian $(lsb_release -cs) stable"
apt-get update && apt-get install docker-ce -y
```

### Yacht

```shell
mkdir -p "/root/.local/share/srv/docker/yacht/"
sudo docker run -d \
    --name="yacht" \
    --hostname "yacht" \
    --restart=unless-stopped \
    --privileged \
    -e TZ="${TZ:-${TIMEZONE:-America/New_York}}" \
    -v "/root/.local/share/srv/docker/yacht/data":/data \
    -v "/root/.local/share/srv/docker/yacht/config":/config \
    -p 8000:8000 \
    selfhostedpro/yacht 1>/dev/null
```

### Portainer

```shell
mkdir -p /root/.local/share/srv/docker/portainer/data
docker run -d -p 9000:9000 \
    --name portainer \
    -v /root/.local/share/srv/docker/portainer/data:/data \
    -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
    portainer/portainer-ce
```

### nginx

```shell
mkdir -p /root/.local/share/srv/docker/nginx-manager/files/{data,config,letsencrypt}
sudo docker run -d \
    --name="nginx-manager" \
    --hostname "$HOSTNAME" \
    --restart=unless-stopped \
    --privileged \
    -e TZ="America/New_York" \
    -e DISABLE_IPV6=true \
    -v "/root/.local/share/srv/docker/nginx-manager/data":/data \
    -v "/root/.local/share/srv/docker/nginx-manager/config":/app/config \
    -v "/root/.local/share/srv/docker/nginx-manager/letsencrypt":/etc/letsencrypt \
    -p 80:80 \
    -p 8888:81 \
    -p 443:443 \
    jc21/nginx-proxy-manager:2
```

guides.name: rocketchat
guides.readmeRaw:
# Rocket.Chat Installation Guide

Open-source team communication platform with features like real-time messaging, video calls, file sharing, and extensive integrations.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS, or compatible)
- 4GB RAM minimum, 8GB recommended
- MongoDB 4.4+ or 5.0+
- Node.js 14.x
- Domain name (for SSL setup)

## Installation

### Using Docker Compose (Recommended)
```bash
# Create project directory
mkdir -p ~/rocketchat && cd ~/rocketchat

# Create docker-compose.yml
cat > docker-compose.yml <<EOF
version: '3.8'

services:
  rocketchat:
    image: registry.rocket.chat/rocketchat/rocket.chat:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      MONGO_URL: "mongodb://mongo:27017/rocketchat?replicaSet=rs0"
      MONGO_OPLOG_URL: "mongodb://mongo:27017/local?replicaSet=rs0"
      ROOT_URL: "https://chat.example.com"
      PORT: 3000
      DEPLOY_METHOD: docker
      REG_TOKEN: \${REG_TOKEN}
    depends_on:
      - mongo
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    volumes:
      - ./uploads:/app/uploads
    networks:
      - rocketchat

  mongo:
    image: docker.io/bitnami/mongodb:5.0
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      MONGODB_REPLICA_SET_MODE: primary
      MONGODB_REPLICA_SET_NAME: rs0
      MONGODB_PORT_NUMBER: 27017
      MONGODB_INITIAL_PRIMARY_HOST: mongo
      MONGODB_INITIAL_PRIMARY_PORT_NUMBER: 27017
      MONGODB_ADVERTISED_HOSTNAME: mongo
      MONGODB_ENABLE_JOURNAL: true
      ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD: yes
    volumes:
      - mongodb_data:/bitnami/mongodb
    networks:
      - rocketchat

  mongo-express:
    image: mongo-express
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      ME_CONFIG_MONGODB_URL: "mongodb://mongo:27017/"
      ME_CONFIG_BASICAUTH_USERNAME: admin
      ME_CONFIG_BASICAUTH_PASSWORD: pass
    ports:
      - "8081:8081"
    depends_on:
      - mongo
    networks:
      - rocketchat

networks:
  rocketchat:
    driver: bridge

volumes:
  mongodb_data:
EOF

# Start services
docker-compose up -d

# Check logs
docker-compose logs -f rocketchat
```

### Manual Installation (Ubuntu/Debian)

#### MongoDB Setup
```bash
# Install MongoDB
wget -qO - https://www.mongodb.org/static/pgp/server-5.0.asc | sudo apt-key add -
echo "deb [ arch=amd64,arm64 ] https://repo.mongodb.org/apt/ubuntu focal/mongodb-org/5.0 multiverse" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb-org-5.0.list

sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y mongodb-org

# Configure MongoDB as replica set
sudo systemctl enable --now mongod

# Initialize replica set
mongo --eval "rs.initiate({_id: 'rs0', members: [{_id: 0, host: 'localhost:27017'}]})"

# Create Rocket.Chat database user
mongo rocketchat --eval "db.createUser({user: 'rocketchat', pwd: 'secure_password', roles: [{role: 'readWrite', db: 'rocketchat'}]})"
```

#### Node.js and Rocket.Chat Setup
```bash
# Install Node.js 14.x
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_14.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt install -y nodejs

# Create rocketchat user
sudo useradd -m -s /bin/bash rocketchat

# Download and install Rocket.Chat
cd /opt
sudo wget https://releases.rocket.chat/latest/download -O rocket.chat.tgz
sudo tar -xzf rocket.chat.tgz
sudo mv bundle Rocket.Chat
sudo chown -R rocketchat:rocketchat /opt/Rocket.Chat

# Install dependencies
cd /opt/Rocket.Chat/programs/server
sudo -u rocketchat npm install

# Set environment variables
sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/rocketchat.service > /dev/null <<EOF
[Unit]
Description=The Rocket.Chat server
After=network.target remote-fs.target nss-lookup.target nginx.service mongod.service
Wants=network.target

[Service]
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/node /opt/Rocket.Chat/main.js
StandardOutput=syslog
StandardError=syslog
SyslogIdentifier=rocketchat
User=rocketchat
Group=rocketchat
Environment=MONGO_URL=mongodb://rocketchat:secure_password@localhost:27017/rocketchat?authSource=rocketchat&replicaSet=rs0
Environment=MONGO_OPLOG_URL=mongodb://rocketchat:secure_password@localhost:27017/local?authSource=admin&replicaSet=rs0
Environment=ROOT_URL=https://chat.example.com
Environment=PORT=3000

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
EOF

# Enable and start service
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl enable --now rocketchat
```

### Snap Installation (Easiest)
```bash
# Install Rocket.Chat via snap
sudo snap install rocketchat-server

# Configure
sudo snap set rocketchat-server mongodb-url="mongodb://localhost:27017/parties"
sudo snap set rocketchat-server root-url="https://chat.example.com"
sudo snap set rocketchat-server port=3000

# Start service
sudo systemctl enable --now snap.rocketchat-server.rocketchat-server
```

## Configuration

### NGINX Reverse Proxy
```bash
# Create NGINX configuration
sudo tee /etc/nginx/sites-available/rocketchat > /dev/null <<EOF
# Upstreams
upstream backend {
    server 127.0.0.1:3000;
}

# HTTPS Server
server {
    listen 443 ssl http2;
    server_name chat.example.com;

    # SSL Configuration
    ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/chat.example.com/fullchain.pem;
    ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/chat.example.com/privkey.pem;
    ssl_protocols TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3;
    ssl_ciphers ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384;
    ssl_prefer_server_ciphers off;

    # Security headers
    add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN";
    add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block";
    add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff";
    add_header Referrer-Policy "no-referrer-when-downgrade";
    add_header Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains" always;

    # Proxy settings
    location / {
        proxy_pass http://backend;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade \$http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
        proxy_set_header Host \$http_host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP \$remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For \$proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto \$scheme;
        proxy_set_header X-Nginx-Proxy true;

        proxy_redirect off;
    }
}

# HTTP to HTTPS redirect
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name chat.example.com;
    return 301 https://\$server_name\$request_uri;
}
EOF

# Enable site
sudo ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/rocketchat /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/
sudo nginx -t && sudo systemctl restart nginx
```

### SSL Certificate Setup
```bash
# Install Certbot
sudo apt install -y certbot python3-certbot-nginx

# Obtain SSL certificate
sudo certbot --nginx -d chat.example.com

# Auto-renewal
sudo crontab -e
# Add: 0 12 * * * /usr/bin/certbot renew --quiet && systemctl reload nginx
```

### Database Optimization
```bash
# MongoDB tuning for Rocket.Chat
sudo tee -a /etc/mongod.conf > /dev/null <<EOF

# Performance tuning
storage:
  wiredTiger:
    engineConfig:
      cacheSizeGB: 2

# Replica set configuration
replication:
  replSetName: rs0

# Security
security:
  authorization: enabled

# Networking
net:
  bindIp: 127.0.0.1
  port: 27017
EOF

sudo systemctl restart mongod

# Create indexes for better performance
mongo rocketchat --eval "
db.users.createIndex({'username': 1}, {background: true});
db.users.createIndex({'emails.address': 1}, {background: true});
db.rocketchat_room.createIndex({'name': 1}, {background: true});
db.rocketchat_message.createIndex({'rid': 1, 'ts': 1}, {background: true});
"
```

## Administration

### User Management via API
```bash
# Get auth token (login as admin first)
curl -H "Content-type:application/json" \
     http://localhost:3000/api/v1/login \
     -d '{"user":"admin", "password":"admin_password"}'

# Create user via API
curl -H "Content-type:application/json" \
     -H "X-Auth-Token: AUTH_TOKEN" \
     -H "X-User-Id: USER_ID" \
     http://localhost:3000/api/v1/users.create \
     -d '{"name":"New User", "email":"user@example.com", "password":"user_password", "username":"newuser"}'

# Create channel
curl -H "Content-type:application/json" \
     -H "X-Auth-Token: AUTH_TOKEN" \
     -H "X-User-Id: USER_ID" \
     http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.create \
     -d '{"name":"general"}'
```

### Backup and Restore
```bash
# Create backup script
sudo tee /usr/local/bin/rocketchat-backup.sh > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
BACKUP_DIR="/backup/rocketchat"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

mkdir -p ${BACKUP_DIR}/{database,uploads}

# Backup MongoDB database
mongodump --host localhost:27017 --db rocketchat --out ${BACKUP_DIR}/database/mongodb-${DATE}
tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/database/rocketchat-db-${DATE}.tar.gz -C ${BACKUP_DIR}/database mongodb-${DATE}
rm -rf ${BACKUP_DIR}/database/mongodb-${DATE}
```

```bash
# On each MongoDB node, configure replica set

rs.initiate({
  _id: 'rs0',
  members: [

    {_id: 1, host: 'mongo2.example.com:27017', priority: 1},

});
```

Rocket.Chat Installation Guide

Open-source team communication platform with features like real-time messaging, video calls, file sharing, and extensive integrations.

Prerequisites

  • Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS, or compatible)
  • 4GB RAM minimum, 8GB recommended
  • MongoDB 4.4+ or 5.0+
  • Node.js 14.x
  • Domain name (for SSL setup)

    • Installation

    Using Docker Compose (Recommended)

    bash 
    # Create project directory
mkdir -p ~/rocketchat && cd ~/rocketchat

# Create docker-compose.yml
cat > docker-compose.yml <<EOF
version: '3.8'

services:
  rocketchat:
    image: registry.rocket.chat/rocketchat/rocket.chat:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      MONGO_URL: "mongodb://mongo:27017/rocketchat?replicaSet=rs0"
      MONGO_OPLOG_URL: "mongodb://mongo:27017/local?replicaSet=rs0"
      ROOT_URL: "https://chat.example.com"
      PORT: 3000
      DEPLOY_METHOD: docker
      REG_TOKEN: \${REG_TOKEN}
    depends_on:
      - mongo
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    volumes:
      - ./uploads:/app/uploads
    networks:
      - rocketchat

  mongo:
    image: docker.io/bitnami/mongodb:5.0
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      MONGODB_REPLICA_SET_MODE: primary
      MONGODB_REPLICA_SET_NAME: rs0
      MONGODB_PORT_NUMBER: 27017
      MONGODB_INITIAL_PRIMARY_HOST: mongo
      MONGODB_INITIAL_PRIMARY_PORT_NUMBER: 27017
      MONGODB_ADVERTISED_HOSTNAME: mongo
      MONGODB_ENABLE_JOURNAL: true
      ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD: yes
    volumes:
      - mongodb_data:/bitnami/mongodb
    networks:
      - rocketchat

  mongo-express:
    image: mongo-express
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      ME_CONFIG_MONGODB_URL: "mongodb://mongo:27017/"
      ME_CONFIG_BASICAUTH_USERNAME: admin
      ME_CONFIG_BASICAUTH_PASSWORD: pass
    ports:
      - "8081:8081"
    depends_on:
      - mongo
    networks:
      - rocketchat

networks:
  rocketchat:
    driver: bridge

volumes:
  mongodb_data:
EOF

# Start services
docker-compose up -d

# Check logs
docker-compose logs -f rocketchat

    Manual Installation (Ubuntu/Debian)

    #### MongoDB Setup

    bash 
    # Install MongoDB
wget -qO - https://www.mongodb.org/static/pgp/server-5.0.asc | sudo apt-key add -
echo "deb [ arch=amd64,arm64 ] https://repo.mongodb.org/apt/ubuntu focal/mongodb-org/5.0 multiverse" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb-org-5.0.list

# Create Rocket.Chat database user

    #### Node.js and Rocket.Chat Setup

    bash 
    # Install Node.js 14.x

    Configuration

    NGINX Reverse Proxy

    bash 
    # Create NGINX configuration
sudo tee /etc/nginx/sites-available/rocketchat > /dev/null <<EOF
# Upstreams
upstream backend {
    server 127.0.0.1:3000;
}

# HTTPS Server
server {
    listen 443 ssl http2;
    server_name chat.example.com;

    # SSL Configuration
    ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/chat.example.com/fullchain.pem;
    ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/chat.example.com/privkey.pem;
    ssl_protocols TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3;
    ssl_ciphers ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384;
    ssl_prefer_server_ciphers off;

    # Security headers
    add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN";
    add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block";
    add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff";
    add_header Referrer-Policy "no-referrer-when-downgrade";
    add_header Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains" always;

    # Proxy settings
    location / {
        proxy_pass http://backend;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade \$http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
        proxy_set_header Host \$http_host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP \$remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For \$proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto \$scheme;
        proxy_set_header X-Nginx-Proxy true;

        proxy_redirect off;
    }
}

# HTTP to HTTPS redirect
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name chat.example.com;
    return 301 https://\$server_name\$request_uri;
}
EOF

    MongoDB Replica Set (Multi-node)

    bash 
    # On each MongoDB node, configure replica set
sudo tee -a /etc/mongod.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
replication:
  replSetName: rs0
  
net:
  bindIp: 0.0.0.0  # Allow connections from other nodes
EOF

sudo systemctl restart mongod

# Initialize replica set (run on primary node only)
mongo --eval "
rs.initiate({
  _id: 'rs0',
  members: [
    {_id: 0, host: 'mongo1.example.com:27017', priority: 2},
    {_id: 1, host: 'mongo2.example.com:27017', priority: 1},
    {_id: 2, host: 'mongo3.example.com:27017', priority: 1, arbiterOnly: true}
  ]
});
"

# Update Rocket.Chat MongoDB URL for replica set
Environment=MONGO_URL=mongodb://mongo1.example.com:27017,mongo2.example.com:27017,mongo3.example.com:27017/rocketchat?replicaSet=rs0

    Verification

    bash 
    # Check service status
sudo systemctl status rocketchat
sudo systemctl status mongod

# Docker verification
docker-compose ps
docker-compose logs rocketchat

# Test web interface
curl -I http://localhost:3000

# Check MongoDB connection
mongo --eval "db.runCommand('ping')"

# Test API endpoint
curl http://localhost:3000/api/info

# Check logs
sudo journalctl -u rocketchat -f
docker-compose logs -f  # For Docker installation

# Check memory usage
ps aux | grep -E "(rocket|mongo)"
docker stats  # For Docker installation

# Test webhooks
curl -X POST https://chat.example.com/hooks/YOUR_WEBHOOK_TOKEN \
     -H "Content-type:application/json" \
     -d '{"text":"Test message from API"}'

    Maintenance and Updates

    Update Rocket.Chat

    bash 
    # Manual installation update
cd /opt
sudo wget https://releases.rocket.chat/latest/download -O rocket.chat.tgz
sudo systemctl stop rocketchat
sudo mv Rocket.Chat Rocket.Chat.backup
sudo tar -xzf rocket.chat.tgz
sudo mv bundle Rocket.Chat
sudo chown -R rocketchat:rocketchat /opt/Rocket.Chat
cd /opt/Rocket.Chat/programs/server
sudo -u rocketchat npm install
sudo systemctl start rocketchat

# Docker update
cd ~/rocketchat
docker-compose pull
docker-compose up -d

# Snap update
sudo snap refresh rocketchat-server

    Database Maintenance

    bash 
    # MongoDB maintenance commands
mongo rocketchat --eval "db.stats()"
mongo rocketchat --eval "db.runCommand({compact: 'rocketchat_message'})"

# Clean up old messages (optional)
mongo rocketchat --eval "
var cutoff = new Date();
cutoff.setDate(cutoff.getDate() - 90);  // Keep 90 days
db.rocketchat_message.deleteMany({'ts': {\$lt: cutoff}});
"

# Repair database if needed
mongod --repair --dbpath /var/lib/mongodb

    Troubleshooting

    bash 
    # Check Rocket.Chat logs
sudo journalctl -u rocketchat -f
docker-compose logs -f rocketchat  # Docker

# Check MongoDB logs
sudo journalctl -u mongod -f
docker-compose logs -f mongo  # Docker

# Test MongoDB replica set status
mongo --eval "rs.status()"

# Check Node.js processes
ps aux | grep node

# Test database connectivity
mongo rocketchat --eval "db.runCommand('ping')"

# Check disk space
df -h /opt/Rocket.Chat
df -h /var/lib/mongodb

# Memory usage analysis
free -h
top -p $(pgrep -d',' node)

# Network connectivity test
telnet localhost 3000
telnet localhost 27017

# Check environment variables
sudo systemctl show rocketchat --property=Environment

# Reset admin password (emergency)
mongo rocketchat --eval "
db.users.update(
  {username: 'admin'},
  {\$set: {'services.password.bcrypt': '\$2a\$10\$n9CM8OgInDlwpvjLKLPML.eizXIzLlRtgCh3GRLafOdR9ldAUh/KG'}}  // password: admin
);
"

    Additional Resources

  • Official Documentation
  • Administrator Guide
  • API Documentation
  • Community Forum
  • GitHub Repository

    • ---

    Note: This guide is part of the HowToMgr collection.

guides.name: terraform
guides.readmeRaw:
# Terraform Installation Guide

Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tool for building, changing, and versioning infrastructure safely and efficiently across multiple cloud providers.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS, or compatible)
- Cloud provider account (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.)
- Basic understanding of infrastructure concepts

## Installation

### Using Package Manager (Recommended)

#### Ubuntu/Debian
```bash
# Add HashiCorp GPG key
wget -O- https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg

# Add HashiCorp repository
echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg] https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com $(lsb_release -cs) main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/hashicorp.list

# Update and install
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y terraform
```

#### RHEL/CentOS/Rocky Linux
```bash
# Add HashiCorp repository
sudo yum install -y yum-utils
sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo https://rpm.releases.hashicorp.com/RHEL/hashicorp.repo

# Install Terraform
sudo yum install -y terraform
```

### Manual Installation
```bash
# Download latest version
TERRAFORM_VERSION="1.5.7"
cd /tmp
wget https://releases.hashicorp.com/terraform/${TERRAFORM_VERSION}/terraform_${TERRAFORM_VERSION}_linux_amd64.zip

# Install
sudo apt install -y unzip  # or yum install -y unzip
unzip terraform_${TERRAFORM_VERSION}_linux_amd64.zip
sudo mv terraform /usr/local/bin/
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/terraform

# Clean up
rm terraform_${TERRAFORM_VERSION}_linux_amd64.zip
```

### Using Docker
```bash
# Create alias for Docker-based Terraform
echo 'alias terraform="docker run --rm -it -v $(pwd):/workspace -w /workspace hashicorp/terraform:latest"' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc

# Or create wrapper script
sudo tee /usr/local/bin/terraform > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
docker run --rm -it \
  -v $(pwd):/workspace \
  -v ~/.aws:/root/.aws:ro \
  -v ~/.azure:/root/.azure:ro \
  -v ~/.config/gcloud:/root/.config/gcloud:ro \
  -w /workspace \
  hashicorp/terraform:latest "$@"
EOF
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/terraform
```

## Configuration

### AWS Provider Setup
```bash
# Install AWS CLI
curl "https://awscli.amazonaws.com/awscli-exe-linux-x86_64.zip" -o "awscliv2.zip"
unzip awscliv2.zip
sudo ./aws/install

# Configure AWS credentials
aws configure
# AWS Access Key ID: YOUR_ACCESS_KEY
# AWS Secret Access Key: YOUR_SECRET_KEY  
# Default region name: us-west-2
# Default output format: json

# Create basic Terraform configuration
mkdir -p ~/terraform/aws-infrastructure
cd ~/terraform/aws-infrastructure

# Create main.tf
cat > main.tf <<EOF
terraform {
  required_version = ">= 1.0"
  required_providers {
    aws = {
      source  = "hashicorp/aws"
      version = "~> 5.0"
    }
  }
}

provider "aws" {
  region = var.aws_region
}

# Variables
variable "aws_region" {
  description = "AWS region"
  type        = string
  default     = "us-west-2"
}

variable "environment" {
  description = "Environment name"
  type        = string
  default     = "development"
}

# VPC
resource "aws_vpc" "main" {
  cidr_block           = "10.0.0.0/16"
  enable_dns_hostnames = true
  enable_dns_support   = true

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-vpc"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Internet Gateway
resource "aws_internet_gateway" "main" {
  vpc_id = aws_vpc.main.id

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-igw"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Public Subnet
resource "aws_subnet" "public" {
  count                   = 2
  vpc_id                  = aws_vpc.main.id
  cidr_block              = "10.0.\${count.index + 1}.0/24"
  availability_zone       = data.aws_availability_zones.available.names[count.index]
  map_public_ip_on_launch = true

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-public-subnet-\${count.index + 1}"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Data source for availability zones
data "aws_availability_zones" "available" {
  state = "available"
}

# Route table
resource "aws_route_table" "public" {
  vpc_id = aws_vpc.main.id

  route {
    cidr_block = "0.0.0.0/0"
    gateway_id = aws_internet_gateway.main.id
  }

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-public-rt"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Route table associations
resource "aws_route_table_association" "public" {
  count          = length(aws_subnet.public)
  subnet_id      = aws_subnet.public[count.index].id
  route_table_id = aws_route_table.public.id
}

# Security group
resource "aws_security_group" "web" {
  name_prefix = "\${var.environment}-web-"
  vpc_id      = aws_vpc.main.id

  ingress {
    from_port   = 80
    to_port     = 80
    protocol    = "tcp"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  ingress {
    from_port   = 443
    to_port     = 443
    protocol    = "tcp"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  ingress {
    from_port   = 22
    to_port     = 22
    protocol    = "tcp"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  egress {
    from_port   = 0
    to_port     = 0
    protocol    = "-1"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-web-sg"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Outputs
output "vpc_id" {
  value = aws_vpc.main.id
}

output "public_subnet_ids" {
  value = aws_subnet.public[*].id
}

output "security_group_id" {
  value = aws_security_group.web.id
}
EOF

# Create terraform.tfvars
cat > terraform.tfvars <<EOF
aws_region  = "us-west-2"
environment = "production"
EOF
```

### Azure Provider Setup
```bash
# Install Azure CLI
curl -sL https://aka.ms/InstallAzureCLIDeb | sudo bash

# Login to Azure
az login

# Create service principal for Terraform
az ad sp create-for-rbac --name "terraform" --role="Contributor" --scopes="/subscriptions/YOUR_SUBSCRIPTION_ID"

# Set environment variables
export ARM_CLIENT_ID="your-client-id"
export ARM_CLIENT_SECRET="your-client-secret"  
export ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID="your-subscription-id"
export ARM_TENANT_ID="your-tenant-id"

# Create Azure Terraform configuration
mkdir -p ~/terraform/azure-infrastructure
cd ~/terraform/azure-infrastructure

cat > main.tf <<EOF
terraform {
  required_providers {
    azurerm = {
      source  = "hashicorp/azurerm"
      version = "~> 3.0"
    }
  }
}

provider "azurerm" {
  features {}
}

# Resource Group
resource "azurerm_resource_group" "main" {
  name     = "\${var.environment}-rg"
  location = var.location
  
  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Virtual Network
resource "azurerm_virtual_network" "main" {
  name                = "\${var.environment}-vnet"
  address_space       = ["10.0.0.0/16"]
  location            = azurerm_resource_group.main.location
  resource_group_name = azurerm_resource_group.main.name

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Subnet
resource "azurerm_subnet" "internal" {
  name                 = "internal"
  resource_group_name  = azurerm_resource_group.main.name
  virtual_network_name = azurerm_virtual_network.main.name
  address_prefixes     = ["10.0.2.0/24"]
}

variable "location" {
  description = "Azure region"
  default     = "East US"
}

variable "environment" {
  description = "Environment name"
  default     = "development"
}
EOF
```

### Google Cloud Provider Setup
```bash
# Install Google Cloud SDK
echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/cloud.google.gpg] https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt cloud-sdk main" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/google-cloud-sdk.list
curl https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt/doc/apt-key.gpg | sudo apt-key --keyring /usr/share/keyrings/cloud.google.gpg add -
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y google-cloud-cli

# Authenticate
gcloud auth login
gcloud config set project YOUR_PROJECT_ID

# Create service account for Terraform
gcloud iam service-accounts create terraform --display-name="Terraform Service Account"
gcloud projects add-iam-policy-binding YOUR_PROJECT_ID --member="serviceAccount:terraform@YOUR_PROJECT_ID.iam.gserviceaccount.com" --role="roles/editor"
gcloud iam service-accounts keys create ~/gcp-terraform-key.json --iam-account=terraform@YOUR_PROJECT_ID.iam.gserviceaccount.com

# Set environment variable
export GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS="$HOME/gcp-terraform-key.json"
```

## Basic Usage

### Initialize and Plan
```bash
# Initialize Terraform (run in project directory)
terraform init

# Format code
terraform fmt

# Validate configuration
terraform validate

# Plan changes
terraform plan

# Apply changes
terraform apply

# Show current state
terraform show

# List resources
terraform state list

# Destroy infrastructure
terraform destroy
```

### State Management
```bash
# Configure remote state (S3 backend example)
cat > backend.tf <<EOF
terraform {
  backend "s3" {
    bucket = "your-terraform-state-bucket"
    key    = "infrastructure/terraform.tfstate"
    region = "us-west-2"
    
    # Optional: DynamoDB table for state locking
    dynamodb_table = "terraform-state-lock"
    encrypt        = true
  }
}
EOF

# Initialize backend
terraform init -migrate-state

# Import existing resources
terraform import aws_instance.example i-1234567890abcdef0

# Move state resources
terraform state mv aws_instance.example aws_instance.web_server
```

### Workspace Management
```bash
# Create new workspace
terraform workspace new production
terraform workspace new staging

# List workspaces
terraform workspace list

# Switch workspace
terraform workspace select production

# Show current workspace
terraform workspace show
```

## Advanced Configuration

### Modules
```bash
# Create reusable module structure
mkdir -p modules/vpc/{variables.tf,main.tf,outputs.tf}

# modules/vpc/variables.tf
cat > modules/vpc/variables.tf <<EOF
variable "vpc_cidr" {
  description = "CIDR block for VPC"
  type        = string
  default     = "10.0.0.0/16"
}

variable "environment" {
  description = "Environment name"
  type        = string
}

variable "availability_zones" {
  description = "List of availability zones"
  type        = list(string)
  default     = ["us-west-2a", "us-west-2b"]
}
EOF

# Use module in main configuration
cat >> main.tf <<EOF

module "vpc" {
  source = "./modules/vpc"
  
  vpc_cidr           = "10.0.0.0/16"
  environment        = var.environment
  availability_zones = ["us-west-2a", "us-west-2b", "us-west-2c"]
}
EOF
```

### Variable Files and Environments
```bash
# Create environment-specific variable files
cat > environments/production.tfvars <<EOF
environment = "production"
instance_type = "t3.large"
min_size = 3
max_size = 10
EOF

cat > environments/staging.tfvars <<EOF
environment = "staging"
instance_type = "t3.small"
min_size = 1
max_size = 3
EOF

# Apply with specific variables
terraform apply -var-file="environments/production.tfvars"
```

## Verification

```bash
# Check Terraform version
terraform version

# Validate configuration
terraform validate

# Check formatting
terraform fmt -check

# Plan with detailed output
terraform plan -detailed-exitcode

# Show current state
terraform show

# Check providers
terraform providers

# Verify remote state
terraform state pull

# Check for configuration drift
terraform plan -refresh-only
```

## Best Practices

### Project Structure
```bash
# Recommended directory structure
mkdir -p terraform-project/{
environments,
modules,
.terraform,
scripts
}

# Create .gitignore
cat > .gitignore <<EOF
# Terraform files
*.tfstate
*.tfstate.*
.terraform/
.terraform.lock.hcl
crash.log
override.tf
override.tf.json
*_override.tf
*_override.tf.json

# Environment files
*.tfvars
.env

# IDE files
.vscode/
.idea/
EOF
```

### Security Practices
```bash
# Use environment variables for sensitive data
export TF_VAR_db_password="your-secure-password"
export TF_VAR_api_key="your-api-key"

# In terraform configuration:
variable "db_password" {
  description = "Database password"
  type        = string
  sensitive   = true
}

# Use data sources for existing resources
data "aws_ami" "ubuntu" {
  most_recent = true
  owners      = ["099720109477"] # Canonical

  filter {
    name   = "name"
    values = ["ubuntu/images/hvm-ssd/ubuntu-jammy-22.04-amd64-server-*"]
  }
}

# Tag everything consistently
locals {
  common_tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = "infrastructure"
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
    Owner       = "devops-team"
  }
}

resource "aws_instance" "web" {
  # ... other configuration
  tags = local.common_tags
}
```

## Troubleshooting

```bash
# Debug with detailed logging
export TF_LOG=DEBUG
export TF_LOG_PATH="terraform.log"
terraform plan

# Check provider configuration
terraform providers schema -json

# Inspect state file
terraform state show aws_instance.web

# Refresh state from real infrastructure
terraform refresh

# Force unlock state (if locked)
terraform force-unlock LOCK_ID

# Import existing resources
terraform import aws_instance.example i-1234567890abcdef0

# Check for unused variables
terraform validate

# Fix state inconsistencies
terraform apply -refresh-only -auto-approve
```

## Integration with CI/CD

### GitHub Actions
```bash
# Create .github/workflows/terraform.yml
mkdir -p .github/workflows
cat > .github/workflows/terraform.yml <<EOF
name: Terraform

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  terraform:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v3
    
    - name: Setup Terraform
      uses: hashicorp/setup-terraform@v2
      with:
        terraform_version: 1.5.7
    
    - name: Terraform Format
      run: terraform fmt -check
    
    - name: Terraform Init
      run: terraform init
      env:
        AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: \${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: \${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
    
    - name: Terraform Validate
      run: terraform validate
    
    - name: Terraform Plan
      run: terraform plan
      env:
        AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: \${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: \${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
    
    - name: Terraform Apply
      if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
      run: terraform apply -auto-approve
      env:
        AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: \${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: \${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
EOF
```

### GitLab CI
```bash
# Create .gitlab-ci.yml
cat > .gitlab-ci.yml <<EOF
stages:
  - validate
  - plan
  - apply

variables:
  TF_ROOT: \${CI_PROJECT_DIR}
  TF_IN_AUTOMATION: "true"

cache:
  key: "\${TF_ROOT}"
  paths:
    - \${TF_ROOT}/.terraform

before_script:
  - cd \${TF_ROOT}
  - terraform --version
  - terraform init

validate:
  stage: validate
  script:
    - terraform validate
    - terraform fmt -check
  rules:
    - if: '\$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_IID'
    - if: '\$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == \$CI_DEFAULT_BRANCH'

plan:
  stage: plan
  script:
    - terraform plan -out="planfile"
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - planfile
  rules:
    - if: '\$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_IID'
    - if: '\$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == \$CI_DEFAULT_BRANCH'

apply:
  stage: apply
  script:
    - terraform apply -input=false "planfile"
  dependencies:
    - plan
  rules:
    - if: '\$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == \$CI_DEFAULT_BRANCH'
      when: manual
EOF
```

## Common Patterns

### Multi-Environment Setup
```bash
# Create environment-specific configurations
mkdir -p environments/{dev,staging,prod}

# environments/dev/main.tf
cat > environments/dev/main.tf <<EOF
module "infrastructure" {
  source = "../../modules/infrastructure"
  
  environment     = "development"
  instance_type   = "t3.micro"
  min_size       = 1
  max_size       = 2
  db_instance_class = "db.t3.micro"
}
EOF

# Apply for specific environment
cd environments/dev
terraform init
terraform plan
terraform apply
```

## Additional Resources

- [Official Documentation](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/docs)
- [Terraform Registry](https://registry.terraform.io/)

- [Best Practices Guide](https://www.terraform.io/docs/cloud/guides/recommended-practices/index.html)

guides.readmeHtml:
Terraform Installation Guide

Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tool for building, changing, and versioning infrastructure safely and efficiently across multiple cloud providers.

Prerequisites

  • Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS, or compatible)
  • Cloud provider account (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.)
  • Basic understanding of infrastructure concepts

    • Installation

    Using Package Manager (Recommended)

    #### Ubuntu/Debian

    bash 
    # Add HashiCorp GPG key
wget -O- https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg

# Add HashiCorp repository
echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg] https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com $(lsb_release -cs) main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/hashicorp.list

# Update and install
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y terraform

    #### RHEL/CentOS/Rocky Linux

    bash 
    # Add HashiCorp repository
sudo yum install -y yum-utils
sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo https://rpm.releases.hashicorp.com/RHEL/hashicorp.repo

# Install Terraform
sudo yum install -y terraform

    Manual Installation

    bash 
    # Download latest version
TERRAFORM_VERSION="1.5.7"
cd /tmp
wget https://releases.hashicorp.com/terraform/${TERRAFORM_VERSION}/terraform_${TERRAFORM_VERSION}_linux_amd64.zip

# Install
sudo apt install -y unzip  # or yum install -y unzip
unzip terraform_${TERRAFORM_VERSION}_linux_amd64.zip
sudo mv terraform /usr/local/bin/
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/terraform

# Clean up
rm terraform_${TERRAFORM_VERSION}_linux_amd64.zip

    Using Docker

    bash 
    # Create alias for Docker-based Terraform
echo 'alias terraform="docker run --rm -it -v $(pwd):/workspace -w /workspace hashicorp/terraform:latest"' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc

# Or create wrapper script
sudo tee /usr/local/bin/terraform > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
docker run --rm -it \
  -v $(pwd):/workspace \
  -v ~/.aws:/root/.aws:ro \
  -v ~/.azure:/root/.azure:ro \
  -v ~/.config/gcloud:/root/.config/gcloud:ro \
  -w /workspace \
  hashicorp/terraform:latest "$@"
EOF
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/terraform

    Configuration

    AWS Provider Setup

    bash 
    # Install AWS CLI
curl "https://awscli.amazonaws.com/awscli-exe-linux-x86_64.zip" -o "awscliv2.zip"
unzip awscliv2.zip
sudo ./aws/install

# Configure AWS credentials
aws configure
# AWS Access Key ID: YOUR_ACCESS_KEY
# AWS Secret Access Key: YOUR_SECRET_KEY  
# Default region name: us-west-2
# Default output format: json

# Create basic Terraform configuration
mkdir -p ~/terraform/aws-infrastructure
cd ~/terraform/aws-infrastructure

# Create main.tf
cat > main.tf <<EOF
terraform {
  required_version = ">= 1.0"
  required_providers {
    aws = {
      source  = "hashicorp/aws"
      version = "~> 5.0"
    }
  }
}

provider "aws" {
  region = var.aws_region
}

# Variables
variable "aws_region" {
  description = "AWS region"
  type        = string
  default     = "us-west-2"
}

variable "environment" {
  description = "Environment name"
  type        = string
  default     = "development"
}

# VPC
resource "aws_vpc" "main" {
  cidr_block           = "10.0.0.0/16"
  enable_dns_hostnames = true
  enable_dns_support   = true

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-vpc"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Internet Gateway
resource "aws_internet_gateway" "main" {
  vpc_id = aws_vpc.main.id

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-igw"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Public Subnet
resource "aws_subnet" "public" {
  count                   = 2
  vpc_id                  = aws_vpc.main.id
  cidr_block              = "10.0.\${count.index + 1}.0/24"
  availability_zone       = data.aws_availability_zones.available.names[count.index]
  map_public_ip_on_launch = true

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-public-subnet-\${count.index + 1}"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Data source for availability zones
data "aws_availability_zones" "available" {
  state = "available"
}

# Route table
resource "aws_route_table" "public" {
  vpc_id = aws_vpc.main.id

  route {
    cidr_block = "0.0.0.0/0"
    gateway_id = aws_internet_gateway.main.id
  }

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-public-rt"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Route table associations
resource "aws_route_table_association" "public" {
  count          = length(aws_subnet.public)
  subnet_id      = aws_subnet.public[count.index].id
  route_table_id = aws_route_table.public.id
}

# Security group
resource "aws_security_group" "web" {
  name_prefix = "\${var.environment}-web-"
  vpc_id      = aws_vpc.main.id

  ingress {
    from_port   = 80
    to_port     = 80
    protocol    = "tcp"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  ingress {
    from_port   = 443
    to_port     = 443
    protocol    = "tcp"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  ingress {
    from_port   = 22
    to_port     = 22
    protocol    = "tcp"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  egress {
    from_port   = 0
    to_port     = 0
    protocol    = "-1"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  tags = {
    Name        = "\${var.environment}-web-sg"
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Outputs
output "vpc_id" {
  value = aws_vpc.main.id
}

output "public_subnet_ids" {
  value = aws_subnet.public[*].id
}

output "security_group_id" {
  value = aws_security_group.web.id
}
EOF

# Create terraform.tfvars
cat > terraform.tfvars <<EOF
aws_region  = "us-west-2"
environment = "production"
EOF

    Azure Provider Setup

    bash 
    # Install Azure CLI
curl -sL https://aka.ms/InstallAzureCLIDeb | sudo bash

# Login to Azure
az login

# Create service principal for Terraform
az ad sp create-for-rbac --name "terraform" --role="Contributor" --scopes="/subscriptions/YOUR_SUBSCRIPTION_ID"

# Set environment variables
export ARM_CLIENT_ID="your-client-id"
export ARM_CLIENT_SECRET="your-client-secret"  
export ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID="your-subscription-id"
export ARM_TENANT_ID="your-tenant-id"

# Create Azure Terraform configuration
mkdir -p ~/terraform/azure-infrastructure
cd ~/terraform/azure-infrastructure

cat > main.tf <<EOF
terraform {
  required_providers {
    azurerm = {
      source  = "hashicorp/azurerm"
      version = "~> 3.0"
    }
  }
}

provider "azurerm" {
  features {}
}

# Resource Group
resource "azurerm_resource_group" "main" {
  name     = "\${var.environment}-rg"
  location = var.location
  
  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Virtual Network
resource "azurerm_virtual_network" "main" {
  name                = "\${var.environment}-vnet"
  address_space       = ["10.0.0.0/16"]
  location            = azurerm_resource_group.main.location
  resource_group_name = azurerm_resource_group.main.name

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
  }
}

# Subnet
resource "azurerm_subnet" "internal" {
  name                 = "internal"
  resource_group_name  = azurerm_resource_group.main.name
  virtual_network_name = azurerm_virtual_network.main.name
  address_prefixes     = ["10.0.2.0/24"]
}

variable "location" {
  description = "Azure region"
  default     = "East US"
}

variable "environment" {
  description = "Environment name"
  default     = "development"
}
EOF

    Google Cloud Provider Setup

    bash 
    # Install Google Cloud SDK
echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/cloud.google.gpg] https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt cloud-sdk main" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/google-cloud-sdk.list
curl https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt/doc/apt-key.gpg | sudo apt-key --keyring /usr/share/keyrings/cloud.google.gpg add -
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y google-cloud-cli

# Authenticate
gcloud auth login
gcloud config set project YOUR_PROJECT_ID

# Create service account for Terraform
gcloud iam service-accounts create terraform --display-name="Terraform Service Account"
gcloud projects add-iam-policy-binding YOUR_PROJECT_ID --member="serviceAccount:terraform@YOUR_PROJECT_ID.iam.gserviceaccount.com" --role="roles/editor"
gcloud iam service-accounts keys create ~/gcp-terraform-key.json --iam-account=terraform@YOUR_PROJECT_ID.iam.gserviceaccount.com

# Set environment variable
export GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS="$HOME/gcp-terraform-key.json"

    Basic Usage

    Initialize and Plan

    bash 
    # Initialize Terraform (run in project directory)
terraform init

# Format code
terraform fmt

# Validate configuration
terraform validate

# Plan changes
terraform plan

# Apply changes
terraform apply

# Show current state
terraform show

# List resources
terraform state list

# Destroy infrastructure
terraform destroy

    State Management

    bash 
    # Configure remote state (S3 backend example)
cat > backend.tf <<EOF
terraform {
  backend "s3" {
    bucket = "your-terraform-state-bucket"
    key    = "infrastructure/terraform.tfstate"
    region = "us-west-2"
    
    # Optional: DynamoDB table for state locking
    dynamodb_table = "terraform-state-lock"
    encrypt        = true
  }
}
EOF

# Initialize backend
terraform init -migrate-state

# Import existing resources
terraform import aws_instance.example i-1234567890abcdef0

# Move state resources
terraform state mv aws_instance.example aws_instance.web_server

    Workspace Management

    bash 
    # Create new workspace
terraform workspace new production
terraform workspace new staging

# List workspaces
terraform workspace list

# Switch workspace
terraform workspace select production

# Show current workspace
terraform workspace show

    Advanced Configuration

    Modules

    bash 
    # Create reusable module structure
mkdir -p modules/vpc/{variables.tf,main.tf,outputs.tf}

# modules/vpc/variables.tf
cat > modules/vpc/variables.tf <<EOF
variable "vpc_cidr" {
  description = "CIDR block for VPC"
  type        = string
  default     = "10.0.0.0/16"
}

variable "environment" {
  description = "Environment name"
  type        = string
}

variable "availability_zones" {
  description = "List of availability zones"
  type        = list(string)
  default     = ["us-west-2a", "us-west-2b"]
}
EOF

# Use module in main configuration
cat >> main.tf <<EOF

module "vpc" {
  source = "./modules/vpc"
  
  vpc_cidr           = "10.0.0.0/16"
  environment        = var.environment
  availability_zones = ["us-west-2a", "us-west-2b", "us-west-2c"]
}
EOF

    Variable Files and Environments

    bash 
    # Create environment-specific variable files
cat > environments/production.tfvars <<EOF
environment = "production"
instance_type = "t3.large"
min_size = 3
max_size = 10
EOF

cat > environments/staging.tfvars <<EOF
environment = "staging"
instance_type = "t3.small"
min_size = 1
max_size = 3
EOF

# Apply with specific variables
terraform apply -var-file="environments/production.tfvars"

    Verification

    bash 
    # Check Terraform version
terraform version

# Validate configuration
terraform validate

# Check formatting
terraform fmt -check

# Plan with detailed output
terraform plan -detailed-exitcode

# Show current state
terraform show

# Check providers
terraform providers

# Verify remote state
terraform state pull

# Check for configuration drift
terraform plan -refresh-only

    Best Practices

    Project Structure

    bash 
    # Recommended directory structure
mkdir -p terraform-project/{
environments,
modules,
.terraform,
scripts
}

# Create .gitignore
cat > .gitignore <<EOF
# Terraform files
*.tfstate
*.tfstate.*
.terraform/
.terraform.lock.hcl
crash.log
override.tf
override.tf.json
*_override.tf
*_override.tf.json

# Environment files
*.tfvars
.env

# IDE files
.vscode/
.idea/
EOF

    Security Practices

    bash 
    # Use environment variables for sensitive data
export TF_VAR_db_password="your-secure-password"
export TF_VAR_api_key="your-api-key"

# In terraform configuration:
variable "db_password" {
  description = "Database password"
  type        = string
  sensitive   = true
}

# Use data sources for existing resources
data "aws_ami" "ubuntu" {
  most_recent = true
  owners      = ["099720109477"] # Canonical

  filter {
    name   = "name"
    values = ["ubuntu/images/hvm-ssd/ubuntu-jammy-22.04-amd64-server-*"]
  }
}

# Tag everything consistently
locals {
  common_tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = "infrastructure"
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
    Owner       = "devops-team"
  }
}

resource "aws_instance" "web" {
  # ... other configuration
  tags = local.common_tags
}

    Troubleshooting

    bash 
    # Debug with detailed logging
export TF_LOG=DEBUG
export TF_LOG_PATH="terraform.log"
terraform plan

# Check provider configuration
terraform providers schema -json

# Inspect state file
terraform state show aws_instance.web

# Refresh state from real infrastructure
terraform refresh

# Force unlock state (if locked)
terraform force-unlock LOCK_ID

# Import existing resources
terraform import aws_instance.example i-1234567890abcdef0

# Check for unused variables
terraform validate

# Fix state inconsistencies
terraform apply -refresh-only -auto-approve

    Integration with CI/CD

    GitHub Actions

    bash 
    # Create .github/workflows/terraform.yml
mkdir -p .github/workflows
cat > .github/workflows/terraform.yml <<EOF
name: Terraform

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  terraform:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v3
    
    - name: Setup Terraform
      uses: hashicorp/setup-terraform@v2
      with:
        terraform_version: 1.5.7
    
    - name: Terraform Format
      run: terraform fmt -check
    
    - name: Terraform Init
      run: terraform init
      env:
        AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: \${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: \${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
    
    - name: Terraform Validate
      run: terraform validate
    
    - name: Terraform Plan
      run: terraform plan
      env:
        AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: \${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: \${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
    
    - name: Terraform Apply
      if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
      run: terraform apply -auto-approve
      env:
        AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: \${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: \${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
EOF

    GitLab CI

    bash 
    # Create .gitlab-ci.yml
cat > .gitlab-ci.yml <<EOF
stages:
  - validate
  - plan
  - apply

variables:
  TF_ROOT: \${CI_PROJECT_DIR}
  TF_IN_AUTOMATION: "true"

cache:
  key: "\${TF_ROOT}"
  paths:
    - \${TF_ROOT}/.terraform

before_script:
  - cd \${TF_ROOT}
  - terraform --version
  - terraform init

validate:
  stage: validate
  script:
    - terraform validate
    - terraform fmt -check
  rules:
    - if: '\$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_IID'
    - if: '\$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == \$CI_DEFAULT_BRANCH'

plan:
  stage: plan
  script:
    - terraform plan -out="planfile"
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - planfile
  rules:
    - if: '\$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_IID'
    - if: '\$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == \$CI_DEFAULT_BRANCH'

apply:
  stage: apply
  script:
    - terraform apply -input=false "planfile"
  dependencies:
    - plan
  rules:
    - if: '\$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == \$CI_DEFAULT_BRANCH'
      when: manual
EOF

    Common Patterns

    Multi-Environment Setup

    bash 
    # Create environment-specific configurations
mkdir -p environments/{dev,staging,prod}

# environments/dev/main.tf
cat > environments/dev/main.tf <<EOF
module "infrastructure" {
  source = "../../modules/infrastructure"
  
  environment     = "development"
  instance_type   = "t3.micro"
  min_size       = 1
  max_size       = 2
  db_instance_class = "db.t3.micro"
}
EOF

# Apply for specific environment
cd environments/dev
terraform init
terraform plan
terraform apply

    Additional Resources

  • Official Documentation
  • Terraform Registry
  • AWS Provider Documentation
  • Best Practices Guide
  • Terraform Examples

    • ---

guides.name: vault
guides.readmeRaw:
# HashiCorp Vault Installation Guide

Secrets management platform for securely storing and accessing API keys, passwords, certificates, and other sensitive data.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS, or compatible)
- Root or sudo access
- 2GB RAM minimum, 4GB recommended
- Persistent storage for Vault data

## Installation

### Using Package Manager (Recommended)

#### Ubuntu/Debian
```bash
# Add HashiCorp GPG key
wget -O- https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg

# Add HashiCorp repository
echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg] https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com $(lsb_release -cs) main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/hashicorp.list

# Update and install
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y vault
```

#### RHEL/CentOS/Rocky Linux
```bash
# Add HashiCorp repository
sudo yum install -y yum-utils
sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo https://rpm.releases.hashicorp.com/RHEL/hashicorp.repo

# Install Vault
sudo yum install -y vault
```

### Manual Binary Installation
```bash
# Download latest Vault
VAULT_VERSION="1.14.1"
cd /tmp
wget https://releases.hashicorp.com/vault/${VAULT_VERSION}/vault_${VAULT_VERSION}_linux_amd64.zip

# Install
sudo apt install -y unzip  # or yum install -y unzip
unzip vault_${VAULT_VERSION}_linux_amd64.zip
sudo mv vault /usr/local/bin/
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/vault

# Create vault user
sudo useradd --system --home /etc/vault.d --shell /bin/false vault
```

### Using Docker
```bash
# Create directories for persistent data
mkdir -p ~/vault/{data,config,logs}

# Create basic configuration
cat > ~/vault/config/vault.hcl <<EOF
ui = true
disable_mlock = true

storage "file" {
  path = "/vault/data"
}

listener "tcp" {
  address     = "0.0.0.0:8200"
  tls_disable = true
}

api_addr = "http://0.0.0.0:8200"
cluster_addr = "https://0.0.0.0:8201"
EOF

# Run Vault container
docker run -d \
  --name vault \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 8200:8200 \
  -v ~/vault/data:/vault/data \
  -v ~/vault/config:/vault/config \
  -v ~/vault/logs:/vault/logs \
  --cap-add=IPC_LOCK \
  vault:latest server -config=/vault/config/vault.hcl
```

## Configuration

### Basic Configuration File
```bash
# Create Vault configuration directory
sudo mkdir -p /etc/vault.d
sudo chown -R vault:vault /etc/vault.d

# Create main configuration
sudo tee /etc/vault.d/vault.hcl > /dev/null <<EOF
# Full configuration options: https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/configuration

ui = true
disable_mlock = true

# Storage backend
storage "file" {
  path = "/opt/vault/data"
}

# HTTPS listener
listener "tcp" {
  address       = "0.0.0.0:8200"
  tls_cert_file = "/opt/vault/tls/tls.crt"
  tls_key_file  = "/opt/vault/tls/tls.key"
}

# HTTP listener (disable in production)
listener "tcp" {
  address     = "127.0.0.1:8201"
  tls_disable = true
}

# Enterprise license (if applicable)
# license_path = "/etc/vault.d/vault.hclic"

# API address
api_addr = "https://127.0.0.1:8200"

# Cluster address  
cluster_addr = "https://127.0.0.1:8201"

# Logging
log_level = "INFO"
log_file  = "/var/log/vault/vault.log"
EOF

# Create data directory
sudo mkdir -p /opt/vault/{data,tls}
sudo chown -R vault:vault /opt/vault

# Create log directory
sudo mkdir -p /var/log/vault
sudo chown vault:vault /var/log/vault
```

### SSL/TLS Certificate Setup
```bash
# Generate self-signed certificate for development
sudo openssl req -x509 -nodes -days 365 -newkey rsa:2048 \
  -keyout /opt/vault/tls/tls.key \
  -out /opt/vault/tls/tls.crt \
  -subj "/C=US/ST=State/L=City/O=Organization/CN=vault.example.com"

sudo chown vault:vault /opt/vault/tls/*
sudo chmod 600 /opt/vault/tls/tls.key
sudo chmod 644 /opt/vault/tls/tls.crt
```
